Reviews.Title: “Review from Very Picky travellers”
Reviews.Author: docjt
Reviews.Content: Wonderful. The staff at this place really feel like a 5 star resort. You can see they are genuinely helpful and ready to make your stay very comfortable. The resort itself is very updated, comfortable, beautiful and clean bathrooms and the restaurant and spa is first class. My wife and I stay at 5 star hotels everytime we travel and this was our best vacation. They have golf carts to drive you around the resort and mercedes cars complimentary for you to drive. They provide bottled water and tons of extras complimentary. We will definitely come back here. Jack T.

Reviews.Title: “Escape to Serenity”
Reviews.Author: lucindaw
Reviews.Content: My friend and I went to Calistoga Ranch for a stay a while ago but the memories still linger which is why I am prompted to write this review. It was my third or fourth stay there. We decided at the last minute to have a romantic night away from the Bay area with our dogs. I called the Ranch and found a great deal on a two bedroom suite.(One of us snores which is an expensive problem when traveling!) We drove up to Calistoga with our two small dogs and arrived at the lovely property to be cordially greeted by the staff and taken immediately to our incredible series of rooms! The two bedroom suite consisted of two bedrooms, two bathrooms, an outside living room, a kitchen(fully functioning) and an inside living room. My friend, who is a sucessful author, expressed a desire to return and stay for a week while writing his next novel. We had scheduled massages in the calming spa and this was the only low point of our visit. Both of us felt the skill level of our therapist was not up to par which was disappointing. We had dinner in the dining room with some friends and it was delicious! I love the dining room as it has a magical view of the gentle mountainside and the staff are very personable. The Ranch is very pet friendly and provides your dogs with treats and bowls for food and water. Dogs are permitted in most areas of the Ranch with the exception of the dining areas. Best Rooms: Spring for a suite if you can afford it as the regular rooms feel cramped to me. All the rooms are nicely furbished and have lovely bathrooms but the suites have nice outdoor areas as well as separate living rooms. Best time to go: I would say the best time to enjoy this resort is in warmer weather as one cant make use of the outdoor areas in winter. Despite the cold temperature when we visited, however, we had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect getaway”
Reviews.Author: extrapagespassport
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights here in April and could not have been more delighted with the property and the staff. Gloria and Gregory did a wonderful job helping us plan winery visits -don't miss Schramsberg but also the tiny winery, Zathila down the road, was a true find that we would never have known about. Bikes are definitely a good way to tour; we did a very nice guided tour but it's not necessary. Just grab a bike and helmut and the map from the hotel and go. We stayed in a one bedroom with living room and loved the setup of the two separate spaces divided by a deck, though families might not. In general, we were great fans of the architectural style - elegant, tasteful, rustic. The outdoor space - both the very private and romantic shower as well as the deck with fireplace - was great; next time we'll try to spend more time on the property just enjoying the chance to relax. The property is big with good hiking trails and we loved the temporary help - the adorable babydoll sheep who are keeping the weeds down in the small onsite vineyard. My husband and I also both enjoyed the spa; my massage was ok but I had the best facial ever from Susan. With so many phenomenal restaurants in the area, we would be inclined to go out for meals. While the distance from the East Coast makes weekend trips to Calistoga impossible for us, we will certainly be back.

Reviews.Title: “nice place”
Reviews.Author: cleeeeeeeeevelander
Reviews.Content: i enjoyed....fireplaces in room were nice touch. well located.nice pool ans hot tub.very quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Walk down memory lane”
Reviews.Author: Pillarofhercules
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Calistoga a number of years back on a honeymoon trip down the west coast of the US. We have literally just been talking about our best ever trips and hotel stays and i thought it only appropriate to come and jot my thoughts down on this property. This is a very special place. We've been privileged to stay in some beautiful places over the years but we often come back to this trip, and to this hotel as one of the highlights (along with the post ranch inn furhter down the coast at big sur). The rooms are great and the feeling of being detached and not centralized withing a building or complex was just great. Loved the pool and the whole outdoor space, including the openness of the gym area. The setting for breakfast was fantastic, and I can honestly say that I had of the best massage treatments of my life at the spa which was also beautiful. This is one of those places that you would feel completely and totally comfortable in recommending to anyone visiting the area. I would go as far as to say that it was worth extending a planned trip 'off piste' to visit. Anyway, great memories, great place. highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “Lovely!”
Reviews.Author: mshtx
Reviews.Content: A splurge - The Calistoga Ranch is expensive but is worth it. The rooms are excellent - living area and bedrooom divided by an outdoor hot tub and deck. We were celebrating my husband's birthday and they delivered champagne and strawberries. Outdoor shower is great. All the right touches. We had one minor complaint while there and the manager, upon seeing our review on this, called us, corrected the issue and emailed us as well. It was handled so professionally. They really do want you to enjoy everything here and make sure that you do. Concierge set up a day of winery visits on Spring Mountain Road and they were all favorites of ours after visiting. Definitely take advantage of her advice and assistance. Go and ENJOY!! In a quieter section of Napa Valley and that is an advantage too. We hiked the area and loved the views.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic!”
Reviews.Author: Victoriaangel1
Reviews.Content: This place is gorgeous and romantic. Peace and privacy galore. Would love to go back again. the best place to stay in Napa.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable property in the heart of wine country”
Reviews.Author: mjpino
Reviews.Content: We spent the last week of our honeymoon at this beautiful property. The minute you arrive at the ranch, you realize that this is going to be an experience like no other. They hand you a glass of champagne to sip by the pool before bringing you to your amazing private bungalow. Our room had one bedroom, 1 1/2 bathrooms, an indoor/outdoor fireplace, hot tub, outdoor shower and separate living room; needless to say, it was awesome! The concierge made dinner reservations for us at all of the local hot spots and a few boutique wineries, which were all incredible. They have cars on site that you can reserve for the day, bikes that you can take for a ride through the vineyards and a beautiful pool to relax by. This was such a wonderful end to our unbelievable California honeymoon and we can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous wine country property”
Reviews.Author: Anomina
Reviews.Content: We spent New Year's Eve at the Calistoga Ranch and thought it was fabulous. The rooms are amazing with both indoor and outdoor accomodations. The space all feels remarkably private and everything is just right -- not excessive but perfectly luxurious in every way. Greg on the concierge team did a terrific job of helping us set up wine visits and also helped with other terrific suggestions for drives, dining, etc. The property is magical with great hiking paths and a terrific spa. We really thought this property was well conceived and very well run. One small call out: We had a great dinner at Auberge which is about 15 minutes away in Rutherfold and were a bit taken aback at the taxi rate to travel there and back (approximately $100 total). The meal was fantastic but the lack of a shuttle to a sister location combined with the expensive taxis (which I think are typical for the area) was surprising to us. Overall, however, the experience was perfect and we certainly enjoyed the meal -- we would recommend dining at any of the places that are recommended in the area as long as you are prepared for these types of fees for the convenience of not driving.

Reviews.Title: “Relax & Restore in Decedant Luxury”
Reviews.Author: traveldiva1932
Reviews.Content: They have thought of everything in this very private escape from the real world. The natural beauty is only enhanced by glorious accomodations. Instead of fighting with the surroundings, the rooms blend in and offer a hidden escape to relax and rejuvinate. The beds are incredibly comfortable and the outdoor shower is not to be missed. It's romantic, great for girls weekends (what I went for) and a special celebration all in one. You could not find a reason to go that this place wouldn't be perfect for. The location is outstanding, we used a fabulous Mercedes SUV available there to combine everyone in one car and when we wanted, took the bikes out. There is not a better place you could find in Napa to experience the beauty of the area and get away from the crowds. I crave going back to regain the peace I found there - it's truly a magical place.

Reviews.Title: “Calistoga Ranch - Napa Valley Perfection!”
Reviews.Author: RLG79
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at Calistoga Ranch for our anniversary and it was beyond amazing. The resort exudes luxury from the moment you arrive and the privacy and beauty of the property immediately give you the relaxation you're seeking. Our "room" was more like a private house. Our living room was in one small house with a fireplace that opened to the outside deck which also housed our own private jacuzzi and our bedroom was in a separate house with a luxurious bathroom and outdoor shower with a beautiful oak tree growing through the deck in front of you. It's clear they have gone above and beyond to build around the nature within the property ultimately elevating the uniqueness of the resort. The property is expansive, but not over crowded providing the privacy one seeks at a five star resort. The restaurant is exceptional and the service across the board outstanding. From the moment we arrived the staff attended to our every need and went out of their way to make our anniversary weekend special and romantic, including leaving champagne and chocolate in our room upon our arrival, gifts from the spa, and congratulations at every turn. Additionally, as I am pregnant they were always accommodating me with special, complimentary non-alcoholic cocktails and sparkling pear juice without me even having to ask! They even included baby products in the gift they provided at the spa. On that note, it should be mentioned that the spa was fantastic as well. We have traveled a lot and are quite picky when it comes to resorts and can honestly say Calistoga Ranch exceeded all of our expectations. As recent San Francisco transplants we will definitely be going back as it has quickly become our favorite weekend get away place!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: 1995sb21
Reviews.Content: Beautiful setting, pure luxury, a must. After checking in we had no desire to leave the property. Took nice hikes, had great food, slept wonderfully, fantastic service, absolutely no complaints. Will definitely go back again and again.

Reviews.Title: “A great retreat in the Valley!”
Reviews.Author: regrace1
Reviews.Content: This is one of my favor places to stay in Calistoga, at arrival we find out you can't not use a car to get to your room, golf carts only or you walk so this make the place very relax. Our "room" it was just like a little house in the forest, out door hot tub, patio, fireplace in a separate building and the bed was in another area with a beautiful bathroom with the best OUT DOOR shower!!! Imagine this in California...just great!! Good food, very nice spa and service! Also they have fancy cars for you to drive at not extra cost!! Great experience!

Reviews.Title: “This is well worth every penny,”
Reviews.Author: Sue D
Reviews.Content: All I need to say is that our experience at the Calistoga was above and beyond our expectations!!!

Reviews.Title: “Impeccable.”
Reviews.Author: abqtarheel
Reviews.Content: Just close your eyes when you get the bill, and your entire experience will be flawless! I spent a weekend here with friends, and we all had a wonderful time. The indoor/outdoor rooms are really delightful, and I felt the setting was very private -- it is like the ultimate luxury camp-out in the woods. I had an unbelievably amazing treatment at the spa, and the lovely setting of the fitness area (also indoor/outdoor) inspired me to enjoy my usual workout even more. The concierges helped us with several arrangements, even including advice on a great picnic spot one day when our intended destination turned out to be too crowded.

Reviews.Title: “Super expensive... but premium luxury & WOW!”
Reviews.Author: HappilyMarriedTravel
Reviews.Content: Calistoga Ranch IS expensive. But, if you enjoy private, classy, luxury, exclusive etc... this is your place to stay in the wine region of Calistoga (near to St Helena, Napa Valley). My husband and I stayed in what we think was the highest Hillside Deluxe Villa and it was secluded and special. We arrived on a Friday to be told of a complimentary 2 hours of wine & cheese tasting. Nice. Then, afterwards we went to dinner at the Lakehouse Restaurant & ordered a steak each for dinner... that wasn't even on the menu... WOW....yummo! You are transported around Calistoga Ranch via Golf buggies... you just call & they come get you. This is simply a fantastic place to stay!!! One of the nicest hotels I have had the privilege to stay at. If you have a luxury budget and want exclusivity & tranquility... definitely, definitely stay here!!!! (NOT for budget conscious.)

Reviews.Title: “Fun stay, even in the rain...”
Reviews.Author: NSIInnerloop2
Reviews.Content: We booked just a single night here as a local getaway from San Francisco, and had a great time. It was definitely one of the priciest weekend escapes we've had, but we enjoyed it nonetheless. The property is great and very tranquil. It was raining quite a bit all weekend while we were there, but we still had a great time. The room is peaceful and private. We loved the on-deck hot tub. It was certainly strange to have rain "inside" your accomodation but if anything it just made it more fun and memorable. On a whim, based on reading other reviews here about the concierge getting French Laundry reservations, we figured what the hell and asked him to see what he could do on short (~48 hours) notice. And, voila, he managed to score us a table for lunch. It was great and unexpected. Loved the spa. Loved the common areas. Enjoyed simply walking around the property looking at the variety of rooms and lovely views. I'd like to go back sometime and maybe do a 2-night stay, relax a bit more and soak up a bit more of the wondering laid back atmosphere. Oh yeah, big fan of the free stocked mini-bar- why don't more hotels do this? I'm sure my satisfaction exceeds the cost to the hotel to stock it!

Reviews.Title: “Superior Stay”
Reviews.Author: smitty5125
Reviews.Content: If you don't mind spending a bit more, you should make a couple of days available to be pampered at this amazing location. The food, spa, and accommodations are 5 Star. And you get free access to the resorts fleet of Mercedes Benz. We drove a GL 550 one day and a convertible the next. Included in our 2 night package, my wife and I received a 90 minute massage and a 4 course dinner. The spa massage was the best we have ever experienced. Just think of being on a hot water bed during your massage. The dinner was top notch. Note also you have the opportunity to experience hiking right on the resort. We only had time for the easier 3/4 mile trail, with views directly over several wineries in Napa Valley. The staff, food, accommodations, service, and scenery were the best. Neither my wife nor I wanted to leave. It was by far the best vacation we've had so far, which includes Jamaica, Cancun, Jackson Hole, Boise, Northern Minnesota, and a few more.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Experience”
Reviews.Author: ccallander
Reviews.Content: Napa Valley presents more than their fair share of unbelievable food, properties and service. Calistoga Ranch is my newest experience among this area's elite properties - Auberge du Soleil, Meadowood Resort, Solage. All are so different and so superior in their own right, but CR blew me away. The size, layout, decor and amenities offered in each room was simply heaven. The property offers privacy and nature unrivaled by any other. Only hotel guests or resident owners can use the facilities and this makes a unique experience. Quiet, peaceful, private and beautiful this place boasts the best of it all. Service, food, attention to detail....all of it puts it on the "must go visit" list for anyone who wants a taste of how the other half lives. Truly decadent, romantic and ultimately relaxing. The spa, restaurant, pool and rooms are all among the best I have ever experienced. "Wow" is the one word that kept coming to mind.

Reviews.Title: “This is the place to enjoy Napa and get away from it all”
Reviews.Author: gothamfoodie
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for a week in August. We are still glowing from our experience. The service is incredible, the rooms are luxurious and stylish, the spa is fantastic, the pool and fitness area are downright dreamy. Everything everywhere is immaculate. There is amazing attention to detail here. We are fussy travelers and this place met our expectations (this place is far from cheap, so we were hoping it would deliver, and it did). And you can't beat getting to borrow their fleet of Mercedes every day! We ditched our SFO rental car and rode in style from Calistoga to Yountville. We both came away thinking that when we return to Napa, we will stay here. You cannot go wrong.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing Experience”
Reviews.Author: DruryS
Reviews.Content: I stayed four days during Christmas holiday. The hotel has a warm atmosphere that makes me relax. I enjoyed taking shower outdoor at night while watching the stars. The spa was superb. Loved the free mercedez loan. The whole experience was really worth what I've paid for.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding!!!”
Reviews.Author: skiqueen48009
Reviews.Content: Absolutely beautiful. Could not imagine a better stay. The accommodations, grounds, staff and spa facilities were all five star.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious Wine Country getaway”
Reviews.Author: rogerad
Reviews.Content: This is my favorite property while visiting Napa - Wine country. I've stayed at Auberge du Soleil, Solage and Carneros Inn, and I prefer the Ranch. The property is ultra luxurious. Once inside your unit (we had a two-bedroom with kitchen) you feel as if you're leaving in a large tree house. The young staff is extremely attentive and knowledgeable. This is a very romantic spot. Yes, it's expensive but worth it. The spa is decadent.

Reviews.Title: “The highs, the lows”
Reviews.Author: SevenContinents07
Reviews.Content: The public spaces (restaurant, lobby, pool, and especially the spa) are absolutely lovely. The service is wonderful - unobtrusive and yet both friendly and first rate. They go out of their way to make you happy. Everything is perfect except for one thing, and it is a doozy. Calistoga Ranch makes this big deal about how every suite is a complex of two buildings, with a deck and a fireplace and a hot tub for your romantic enjoyment. What they don't mention is that both the hot tub AND the bedroom hover over the road. Not near the road - on the road. Why spend $1200 a night for a suite with a hot tub where you have to wear your bathing suit to swim AND have to keep your voice down (way down) in your room? It was like cuddling in the back seat of a car parked on the main street of town. If you get what I mean...

Reviews.Title: “the lap of luxury”
Reviews.Author: canesmiami1
Reviews.Content: My wife, brother & I spent 3 nights this past July at the Calistoga Ranch. 5 star luxurious is a great description to start. From the moment we entered the ranch until our departure, everything was fantastic. Friendly staff, with a welcome glass of wine upon arrival. Stayed in the estate lodge & were blown away by the accomdations. Up high in the canyon above the Lakehouse restaurant, the accomodations were fabulous. Separate living quarters for living, dining, and bedrooms, all connected by decks with outdoor furniture, fireplaces, hot tubs, and trees growing in between. Lovely bedrooms with huge outdoor showers & every amenity you could think of. Great pool area with exceptional cocktails. Ate 1 dinner & 3 breakfasts at the Lakehouse & all were good. As part of our stay we had the exclusive use of the 550 Mercedes convertible, and they also have a fleet of Mercedes for anyone to use on a first come/first serve basis. Easy drive to Bouchon, Au Berge, French Laundry. Wonderful boutique wineries right near by. If you go to the Frank Family winery just down the road, you get of of a kind wines to try if you let them know you are staying at the ranch(one the winery owners has a son working there) All in all, one of the best places we have ever stayed. Can't wait to do it again!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wow is all I can say”
Reviews.Author: tamstrat
Reviews.Content: Hubby and I like to go to the Napa area at least once a year, we had never stayed at the Calistoga Ranch. It is pricey....hold your breath when booking, but absolutely worth the stay. We arrived and the reception and concierge were excepetional in their friendliness and willing to accomodate us. Our accomodations was lovely. A deck with a double sided fire place, jacuzzi and out door shower was lovely. The cabin was a little closer to neighboring cabins than what we had anticipated, but no problem. Hubby and I ate one night at the Lakehouse Restaurant and it wa lovely and very quiet. The only negative was the last night we were there, there were some "rowdies" or "yahoos" AKA drunks (I don't know if it was from a wedding party or what) raising hell down the street from us, yelling, making noise later at night, in total fairness, the hotel went down and called them out and told them to cool it.....did not make us think negative of the resort, they can't be held responsible for people who can't maintain, the resort did the best they could to handle it. The congierge, I believe his name was Jeffrey, went out of his way to accomodate us on restaurnt reservations, taxi ride, etc. The valets were also amazingly nice and friendly. My husband and I so enjoyed sitting out on our outdoor deck with the doublesided fireplace on, listening to great "70[s music, in the hot tub with a bottle of wine, it was amazing. The outdoor shower was awesome as well. I would move in permanently if I could. This is an awesome place if you are willing to drop some cash for an awesome resort experience. Thank you, God willing, we will return!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: rdkflk
Reviews.Content: My favorite part of the Calistoga Ranch were the plantings and landscaping. Absolutely beautiful. The Oleander trees at the pool are so beautiful. The pool reminded me of Villa St. Michele outside Florence. Rooms were nice but not over the top. Our lodge was lovely but they do seem on top of each other. Did not feel a breach in privacy just our view was straight into another building and coming from NY would have preferred a view into the woods? Will ask next time if this is an option. We went with our two boys ages 6 and 11. They lived in the hot tub on the porch. The outside shower was great as well. Products in the bathroom were loved by all. The separate rooms were great and allowed us a lot of options between sleeping area and areas where people needed to work or watch TV. Unfortunately cell service was very bad at the room so that caused some issues in terms of trying to get some work done. We had dinner one night at the Lakehouse which was good but I think in the future we will opt to go off campus as there are so many options. The little town of Calistoga is charming and worth a trip. The Spa at the Ranch was exceptional. We had a fabulous masseuse who was really one of the best and facilities were lovely and unique. One of the best massages I have ever had.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay but didnâ€™t quite meet expectations”
Reviews.Author: Fleetcat
Reviews.Content: We arrived at 2pm but our room was not destined to be ready until the check in time of 4pm. We sat in the pool bar which was OK and had a Thai beef salad for lunch â€“ huge â€“ one for two more than adequate but not much beef. I think however the attitude of reception set the tone â€“ i.e. come up at 4pm and your room will be ready vs. we will come and let you know. If they had come at ten to four we would have been delighted and felt we had a win â€“ they didnâ€™t. We hoped for two days of peace and a rural idyll prior to embarking on some serious wine country drinking. When I saw our room I was initially a tad disappointed as it didnâ€™t appear as nice as the photos. I took a photo and it looked exactly like the internet â€“ this place is photogenic! Looking at the cabins on the website I hadnâ€™t appreciated that they are basically all side by side in a row. I had a sense of far more privacy and seclusion. Not the case â€“ buggies going by all day and audio insight into our next door neighboursâ€™ showering experience. The Lakeview restaurant is good. Lovely clean food without fuss and our preference of small portions. Other good things. Deer at night sneaking around nibbling foliage, free minibar, decent coffee, good room service and perfect dappled shade over your outside living area (in Oak Creek lodge anyway). We decided that we liked Calistoga Ranch but it is very expensive for what it is. NB I wrote the above a few days ago. Since we have stayed at Bardessono in Yountville and the Post Ranch Inn in Big Sur - $500 and $300 dollars a night cheaper respectively and both blew us away - it is possible!.

Reviews.Title: “Most amazing girls get away”
Reviews.Author: Emily H
Reviews.Content: I recently had a weekend girls getaway here I can not say enough good things about our stay. From the moment we arrived we were treated like queens. The staff was so attentive and friendly and our room was immaculate! From breakfast at the lake house to lounging at the peaceful pool (we named the "fountain of youth" ) every slow passing hour was pure enjoyment. I will be returning soon only with more friends and family to share the experience.

Reviews.Title: “Calistoga Ranch is the BEST ! ! !”
Reviews.Author: BayouCityTraveler
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay at Calistoga Ranch but not the first stay on an Auberge property. There was a expected level of service and comfort but what was given after we arrived on the property far exceeded what we expected. You are at the Northern end of the valley but you are closer than you think to the other towns. You do give up your vehicle to the valet whenever you are on the property, but have no fear, there are golf cart shuttles with the absolute best bellmen (thank you Shane) that will take you wherever you need to go "in a blink of an eye". The grounds are very safe and well kept with fountains in front of some lodges and are just a pleasure to stroll around. The front desk staff are very welcoming and pleasant and Greg is one of the best Guest Relations Coordinators around. Breakfast and service in the Lakehouse was very good with a nice selection of items. Dinner was a preset menu. Since the Lakehouse is only for registered guests, it seems as if you have the entire dining space to yourself. Beautiful canyon and lake views. We even saw deer that evening. The Bay Forest Spa Lodge was TERRIFIC ! ! Some members were concerned that the spa was visible by others but I did not find that to be a problem. Maybe it was the placement of our lodge. Since the open area is raised and there is very little traffic in front of your lodge to begin with, you should have a fair amount of privacy. Note that it is located in the front rather than the back of the lodge. Take that into consideration "party people". The other lodges do not overlook your outdoor area at all. A large outdoor living area with fireplace sets the tone. The bedroom and bathroom were equally as wonderful. The mindset of indoor and outdoor is nonexistent sometimes. Speaking of outdoor, the outside shower is a MUST ! ! ! One of the highlights of the stay. A huge bathroom that also blurred the line between indoor and outdoor. If I had one thing to say it would be the consistency of the bath towels. Not what I expected considering my surroundings. A great sound system and comfortable furnishings are a welcome retreat after a day of tastings, however, I could see how in the cooler tempertures the floor plan would not benefit some, but you are a part of nature first here. Overall, this is a wonderful property with a great staff that will have us returning to the ranch.

Reviews.Title: “Wanted to love it....but....”
Reviews.Author: brooke103
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from our 2 night stay at Calistoga Ranch celebrating his 40th birthday in Napa. I read all of the reviews and wanted to stay someplace extra-special for this momentous occasion. To give you an idea, the 2 days prior to arriving we were in Monterey staying at the Lodge at Pebble Beach and I gave my husband a round of golf at the famous course. I wanted this to be a weekend to remember! Let me start by saying that I was really, really, really excited about staying at Calistoga Ranch. The pictures of the website were amazing and we had heard nothing but great things about it. I wanted to come back and rate it 5 stars and rave on and on about how perfect our weekend was. Unfortunately I spent the last hour there on-line looking at where we would stay in Napa the next time. Let me start with the positives, as I did rate this a 3 because there were some really great things about the place. First of all, it is a beautiful property and is very peaceful and serene. We stayed in the very top room which was extremely secluded and special. We never heard a peep from anyone up there, which we absolutely loved. The outdoor shower was the highlight - I could have showered for hours out there in the crisp morning air. We loved the breakfast....the banana walnut pancakes were heaven on earth. They did a fabulous job of accommodating us when we were in a rush one morning and Shelly got us in and out quickly. She was fantastic both mornings we ate there - very helpful and great attitude. Lastly I appreciated that they noted my husband's birthday and had a nice card in the room greeting us upon arrival. Unfortunately we felt that we paid too much for what we got overall. For $910 a night, we expected great service like we have received at countless other resorts in that price range. Had we paid $400/night, I think we would have been more lenient. First of all, I got an e-mail from the concierge a couple weeks before with a "pre-arrival" form to fill out with any requests I might have for our trip. I did request a dinner reservation at their restaurant on the night of our arrival, and also assistance with setting up a driver for our day touring the wineries. I submitted the form and never heard a peep. I ended up calling the restaurant myself and making the reservation. I also searched the internet and found my own driving service, as well as wineries to visit based on reviews. (To give Calistoga Ranch some credit, I did tell someone about this once we were there and we received a complimentary bottle of wine in our room with an apology note.) However, I was still disappointed that I ended up doing all of the work myself. After our arrival, I got an "in room" pedicure from the spa. Apparently they do not provide this service at the spa itself, and recently started offering it in the rooms since they had so many requests for it. I've never heard of a high-end spa that doesn't offer pedicures! The very nice girl came to give me my pedicure, and although she was as sweet as can be, the pedicure was one of the worst I've had. Notably, she soaked my feet in cold water. She did not use a basecoat and applied the very dark nail polish straight onto my bare toenails. I don't even want to know how yellow my toenails will be after that! She did not use anything to exfoliate except for a light lotion that had some exfoliating beads in it. The toenail polish was too thick so the finished result was bumpy and uneven. Then I got the bill and it was $105 for a pedicure!! I've never paid that much, even at nice spas where you frankly get so much more. So for $105 I will have to get it redone at home, as my feet still have dry skin and the nail polish doesn't look good. So I decided to let that one go and just enjoy our wonderful stay at the beautiful resort. My husband and I headed to dinner at the Lakehouse. I find it funny that they advertise it as having a view of the "lake"....which in my book was a very small pond. Still, it was peaceful and pleasant, and we were looking forward to a fantastic meal. We were presented menus for a four-course fixed-price meal, and that appeared to be the only option. We chose our courses and were waiting for our 2nd course when we heard the table next to us talking about items that we never saw on our menu. Some of them sounded good! So I called one of the servers over to ask if there was a menu that was not presented to us. He promptly told us that it is a menu of "bar food" and something that they let the kids order off of. We believed him and finished out our meal. The next day we saw this supposed menu of "bar food" and realized it was a regular dinner menu with steak and duck and other items. Although we enjoyed our dinner, we felt deceived that we were only given the one (very expensive) option. The next day we had an incredible day touring wineries, and we returned to the resort to change clothes while our driver waited for us to take us to dinner. They took us up via golf cart to our room, which as we mentioned was at the very top of the resort and quite a hike. We asked the young man to come back in 15 minutes to pick us up, as we would be heading back down to meet our driver. After 15 minutes we started walking, figuring we'd meet him shortly on his way up and hop on for a ride. We got almost all the way to the bottom, at which point my feet were KILLING me in heels, and he drove past us with some other guests. He saw us and said out loud, "Oh no!" realizing that he had forgotten to return to get us. I was not a happy camper. A few other comments on the layout of the resort in general....and it's somewhat repetitive to what other reviewers have said. It does seem a bit strange seeing high-end villas set up like row houses. My husband and I paid a little extra to be up at the top and have a little more privacy, but we both commented how happy we were that we did that as the rooms at the bottom of the resort seem to have no privacy. Also, I was a bit surprised at how small the rooms were for the basic 600 sq ft room. I realize now that the 600 sq ft is including the outdoor deck and outdoor shower as "living space" which leaves you with a very small master bedroom and bathroom. We expected more for $910 a night. Like I said, I really wanted to love this place. I wanted it to be special for my husband's birthday. The room we had at the Lodge at Pebble Beach was the same price and was far superior with a wood-burning fireplace and a private outdoor jacuzzi. For the money, we will definitely look elsewhere in Napa next time.

Reviews.Title: “No lasting impressions!”
Reviews.Author: Irreverent
Reviews.Content: I had fond memories of this resort from a previous stay at least 5 years back. Fast forward to July 2011. My brother and sister in law were coming to CA for a 2 week holiday "up the coast" from LA. Having not seen them in many years, I offered to treat them to 3 nights at The Ranch as a culmination of their trip. We planned a Mon, Tues, Wed to avoid the weekend. I requested the 2-bedroom Estate Lodge ($3995/night) for the trip. Unfortunately, they couldn't accommodate us on the opening night so we settled for a hillside lodge for me ($910/night) and a 1-bedroom creek lodge for them ($1410/night) for Monday with a move to the Estate Lodge on Tues/Wed. We were psyched for the experience! About 3 weeks prior to arrival I received an email from the concierge requesting whether we were interested in arranging a private tour of wineries not open to the public. About a week later I replied that we were indeed interested, but received no reply. Several days prior to our arrival I emailed the concierge again on the same issue. Radio silence. So before we even arrived I told my brother they were at 4 stars (not 5) due to this oversight. I assumed they would rebound to 5 stars. I was wrong. Picture perfect drive up from the city with an intervening lunch at Bouchon, arriving at the Ranch at 2:00. Neither room was ready upon check in and the concierge was overwhelmed on the phone, so I never got to bring up the lack of response issue directly or with the front desk staff. I did request a call from the manager -- a business associate's parents were acquainted was an additional reason. I never received a call from the manager during the entire stay. I requested the SF Chronicle as my morning paper. I got it the first day in the hillside lodge, but it never followed me to the Estate Lodge. I had to request it both mornings at the Lakehouse for breakfast (only to have a driver bring it up). The perfunctory welcome card in my 1st room was addressed to a different person. Mr "So & So." Oooops. We had a simple late (9:00) dinner at the Lakehouse the first night. Perfect. The next day we got into the Estate Lodge around 4:00. It's at the VERY top of the property which may not be advantageous. Much of the welcome breeze by the pool when it's hot is absent in the upper reaches of the resort and there is no overhead fan (they should add this) in the outdoor common area of the Lodge. Also, this is where the delivery trucks park in the mornings and you get a direct view of the service dock of the restaurant upon leaving the Lodge. Ugh. Once in The Lodge you have privacy and it consists of a kitchen/dining, living, guest & master living units. Unfortunately, if you are relegated to the "guest" room as I was, you forfeit the great outdoor shower that was standard in my 1st night "entry level" accommodation. I love their simple, but heavy shaded pool area. The oleander have been trained into trees, always in bloom and serving as shade trees. The setting is mostly adults only during the early week even in high season. Low key indeed, but it took exactly 1 hour for a server to approach me during my 2nd full day at the pool. I was nursing the bottle of water I brought from the room all that time. The bell/valet staff were super friendly & efficient. A high point of the experience. But, not without fault. The Estate Lodge comes with access to a complimentary Mercedes and my relatives opted for the E550 convertible for 2 days of wandering throughout the valley while I stayed at the pool. Despite a request to clean the windshield of bugs and/or replace depleted wiper fluid (empty light on), we were always presented with a bug riddled window car. Note to valet: Clean the windshield! BTW. Securing the premier unit on the property does not secure you any additional amenities. No basket, no bubbles, no chocolate, no fresh flowers. You get the same 4 green apples in a bowl, the same complimentary bottle of Calistoga Ranch chardonnay, the same welcome note (addressed to the right person this time). At approximately $13,000 for a 3 night stay, was it worth it? No. Would you go again? Probably not despite the beauty and allure of the place.

Reviews.Title: “Always longing to come back - Never wanting to leave!”
Reviews.Author: Asta72
Reviews.Content: Rating: A shining 5! Again! This was our 3rd time here and we have had nothing but perfection, and wonderful times, during each of our stays!!! The location is gorgeous, the rooms special, beautiful and blissfully private and quiet, the layout cool/practical and the staff extremely helpful and nice. CanÂ´t fault it. For those of you hesitating in between the "other" Auberge resort and this one i can only say one thing, i would pick Calistoga every time. ItÂ´s just a fresher, more fun and more up-to-date take on luxury! Location: Secluded and beautifully set in beween "mountains" in Calistoga right off the Silverado trail which is gorgeous. Try to avoid the Highway at all times! Room: We had room 103 this time which is a one bedroom spa creek lodge. ItÂ´s located near the reception so only a short walk from the pool, but a bit of a hike from the restaurant. CanÂ´t have it all i guess...But they have a lot of speedy buggies so one never has to wait! The way that they have placed all of their accomodations makes that you pretty much canÂ´t go wrong. ItÂ´s a very private resort and considering that everyone has their own little lodge itÂ´s also very quiet. The bed is extrememly comfortable!! Large bathroom with his and her sides and a lovely outdoor shower. The only thing in the room thatÂ´s not great is the fact that thereÂ´s very little storage room for clothes and bags. We also had an outdoor jacuzzi and a separate livingroom area. Another great feature is the fireplace that you can enjoy from both in and outside. Was really perfect to sit next to eat while we had our breakfast outdoors and it was still a bit nippy outside. Another charming thing is all the animals you see from your cabin. Deer, racoons and a huge range of birds! Staff: So very friendly and serviceminded. They are a delight to deal with all of them! Always smiling and always helpful! They are quite a young crowd so the energy is great! Service: See staff above. Can not think of a thing to complain about. Which is rare hahaha But i would like to mention that i even like their turn-down service as they provide such nice and quirky gifts every night. Loved the jelly-beans, massage oil and lavender! Internet: This was the only thing i was not impressed about. It was very spotty depending on where on the property you are. If i, for instance, had not brought my own wireless router i would not have been able to go online at all! BUT i was told that they are in the process to install access points in all the rooms soon so that should be a glitch of the past. Once online it was fast. ThereÂ´s also no annoying/complicated log-in process which is always smooth + free which is should be everywhere in this day and age! Laundry service: Very good. They even laundered my husbands shirt on the Sunday when thereÂ´s normally no laundry service and even managed to deliver it 2 hours before agreed upon! Food: Very good and expensive, especially the breakfast. ThereÂ´s only one "proper" restaurant. But you can order in-room dining at the pool which is always a nice touch. ThereÂ´s also a restaurant at the pool with lighter, and very fresh, items. There is also a picnic that one can order that has a very nice selection and itÂ´s a charming idea! Amenitites/Minibar/Entertainment: Great amenities for the bathtub! Minibar sufficently stocked. That said, all that is in there upon check-in is also free, great stuff!!! Their movie selection is rather large and you can choose to watch a movie either in the livingroom or the bedroom. Comfort... Giftshop: DonÂ´t expect to get your Pringles and fashion-mag fix there...But hey thatÂ´s why thereÂ´s a CVS and such not too far away hahah. BUT they do have some very nice and luxurious organic skincare. Plus the usual bikinis and such Spa: Expensive, but very very, very good. We have had several treatments there during our 2nd and 3rd stay stay and were in heaven each time! If you get the chance do the Healing Waters, please do as itÂ´s a very special experience... Doug is btw an excellent massage therapist. Very giving, and very firm touch! Pool: I must confess that itÂ´s not very exciting or large. But you have lovely mountain and forest views from it. Wish there was more shade available once in the water The pool loungers are plentiful and comfortable. Service is as always very pleasant. I especially found Brie charming and super service minded! Gym: There is one, but didnÂ´t use it so canÂ´t comment. Things to see/do: Eat! Drink! Relax! Need i say more...? Joking aside, there are some serious restaurants here, but make sure to book some of them (French Laundry for example) waaaaay ahead.

Reviews.Title: “total luxury in the nature”
Reviews.Author: veronica2001
Reviews.Content: Calistoga Ranch is a unique hotel. I personally don't like ranch style, but this one very different and calm. It makes you feel you live in the forest, it is serene, beautiful, excellent service. They take you anywhere you want with golf carts, anytime. If you don't want to walk not a problem. The restaurant is outdooe and indoor, complete beauty and one of akind scenery and nature. It is expensive, but all worth it. The spa is a complete relaxing place all in the nature as well, worth to try. All rooms have shower outside but complete privacy of course. It is alovely experience overall.

Reviews.Title: “Calistoga Ranch is a First Class Resort All the Way - - A Truly Stellar Experience”
Reviews.Author: CliffLIL
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently spent our wedding anniversary (week) at Calistoga Ranch ("CR"). It was our first visit to the resort and our first trip back to Napa Valley in approximately 16 years. We live substantially all year in the Scottsdale-Paradise Valley sector of Phoenix, AZ and three months each year in our summer vacation home in Southampton, NY. Because of where we reside, we spend much of our day-to-day lives at world class resorts and spa properties. Over the years, we have travelled fairly extensively throughout the U.S. , the Carribean and Europe (usually at five-star resorts and at luxury boutique properties). Accordingly, our expectations for CR were quite high. We're very pleased to convey that our experience at CR matched, and in many respects exceeded, our highest expectations. For starters, the property is absolutely beautiful - - a serene and stunning amalgam of rustic, natural, elegant and luxurious facilities and accomodations thoughtfully positioned (terraced) in a wooded, pine-fragranced hillside with a small lake and a running creek. The professional staff is exceptionally gracious, volunteering and knowledgeable. We accepted many (breakfast, lunch and dinner) dining suggestions and vineyard tour recommendations from the concierge staff; and there wasn't a single disappointment among them. We stayed (resided) in one of the beautiful private oak creek spa lodges. The rooms are very spacious, comfortable, airy, contemporary and well-appointed . The "indoor-outdoor" concept is rather unique, as is the private nature of the entire resort/spa property - - there is absolutely no auto "thru traffic" allowed, and the restaurant, spa, fitness center and pool facilities are not accessible to non-guests. This adds to the experience of being a pampered member of an exclusive club - - a home-type atmosphere. Unfortunately, I have certain chronic medical conditions which restrict my ability to indulge in certain cuisine. Fortunately, this was a non-issue during our stay - - the Lakehouse chefs prepared for me numerous "off-the-menu" dishes real-time upon my request. The food was beautifully presented and delicious, including the many creative and flavorful appetizers, entres and desserts that my wife was able to enjoy without restriction (I viewed them from afar and enjoyed them vicariously). As part of a cross-sell promotion with local (Napa) Mercedes Benz dealerships, CR maintains on-site and offers its guests for daily use, at no charge on a first-come/first-serve basis, several current model sedans, sports coupes, convertibles and SUVs. We took advantage of this almost every day. This was quite a nice added perquisite. When (not if) we return to Napa Valley (and we're already reviewing our 2012 calendar), we will definitely return to CR. We'd mention the room number (which we'll most certainly request for our return stay), but we do not want to give the readers of this review the opportunity to make the room potentially unavailable when we return :-)) Overall, our experience was romantic, celebratory, relaxing and first class all the way. It was everything we hoped for and needed in terms of suspending the often arduous routine of daily life. It was difficult to leave (notwithstanding how fortunate we are to call Paradise Valley, AZ and Southampton, NY "home") We are certain to return to CR and recommend this splendid resort most highly to anyone seeking a truly memorable, stellar vacation experience. Thank you CR. We'll visit you again soon. Cliff & Lillian

Reviews.Title: “Incredible stay in a beautiful environment”
Reviews.Author: docscott17
Reviews.Content: We stayed recently in the estate lodge which was amazing and perfect for 2 couples. Although pricey, the place was imaculate with a gorgeous oudoor living room as well as seperate master suites, kitchen/dining room, and an indoor living room. The place was secluding and set into nature. We had the use of the resort's Mercedes S400 during our stay. Snacks and drinks in the lodge were included. In addition, the management sent champagne and dessert for our friend's birthday. Spa, Lighthouse restaurant and pool area were great. Although located in northern Napa valley, it was an easy drive to restaurants and wineries. Highly recommended...one of the best places I've been to.

Reviews.Title: “Removed, cozy, quiet, and relaxing”
Reviews.Author: jmainelli
Reviews.Content: Loved our room at Calistoga Ranch. It's like a little house! We did not use our outdoor living room as it was January and a little chilly, but I still love the concept. We used the hot tub every night though. And the outdoor shower was nice even in January because the steam makes it warm enough to be outside. The spa here is unbelievable. We have stayed at Auberge du Soleil as well (their sister property) and these two places have some of the nicest spas I've ever been to. The restaurant was kind of boring. It was fun to not leave the property one night though. They pick you up and drive you there in a golf cart so it's just very easy. My husband's favorite part of this place was the Mercedes you can check out as loaners. I have to admit - even I thought this was pretty cool! Location was nice for us because we've stayed in Sonoma and more central Napa before so we explored another neck of the woods!

Reviews.Title: “Calistoga Ranch is one of my favorite places - can't wait to return!”
Reviews.Author: bunnymoon
Reviews.Content: From the glasses of wine at check-in, to the bottle of bubbles to welcome us to our room and mark our anniversary, this was an elegant experience that was also relaxed and easy to enjoy. Loved the hillside lodge, the views, the hot tub, and was surprised to see that I used the outdoor shower often. We stayed in one night by the fire, and enjoyed a well-done turndown service. The staff was excellent. I enjoyed the private setting. Views were great, and the hiking trails should not be missed! Great location to other wineries and restaurants- if you can force yourself to leave the property! Highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Yes, it's expensive - And yes, it's worth every single penny.”
Reviews.Author: MrPhotoID
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from a six night stay at the Calistoga Range. The short version - Go. It is - simply - incredible. Hereâ€™s the longer version: The Property: Entire setting is amazing. In the woods/valley, the entire place feels, smells, sounds like retreat should. The pine trees smell amazing and the creek is everything it should be this time of the year. The entire property north of the main lodge is car free. You can either walk or catch a ride with the myriad of attended golf carts. The lack of cars makes the entire venue very relaxed and quiet. All resorts should do this. We rented a Bay Forrest Lodge. It had one bedroom and another 'living' room connected by a covered porch. The wall between the porch and the living room had a double sided gas fireplace. Very nice. One thing to know about the Bay Forrest Lodges (without the outdoor hot tub (spa), is that the road leading up to the 'top' of the property runs behind these particular units. There is a tall fence, but if you are very noise sensitive, you may hear an occasional truck going up the road 'behind' you. IMO, it's not a deal breaker for those units as you might hear 3 trucks in an entire day. The units that this pertains to are 110-120 and are all considered Bay Forrest Lodges. If you want the most serene experience, spring for the Oak Creek Lodges w/ Spa. They are on the other side of the property and have only foot traffic and an occasional golf-cart cruising by. That is the only minor nit in an otherwise epic experience. The Food: We ate breakfast every day at the Lakehouse (on property). The banana/pecan pancakes were so good, we had them every single morning. The dinner there looked very good - and is traditional four course fair - but my wife wasn't feeling like a multi-course meal when we arrived. No trouble, they were happy to make up a hybrid chicken salad for her. We ended up eating at several restaurants off the property, so I canâ€™t comment beyond breakfast. The Spa: Best spa setting, service, treatments we have ever experienced. The spa, like the lodging, is not inexpensive. Like the lodging, itâ€™s worth it. Outdoor showers rule. The Service: Every single person that we interacted with at the Calistoga Ranch (and Spa) exhibited not only very 4 star service, but did so with such genuine enthusiasm, that it really made you feel like a very welcomed guest in someoneâ€™s home. They were extraordinarily kind to my wife, who is several months pregnant with our first child. The Team there really is the icing on a magnificent cake. Weâ€™re still talking about â€˜the peopleâ€™ we met on-property. Extras: Calistoga Ranch has worked out an arrangement with Mercedes to provide a fleet of cars & SUV for their guests to use. Since we were on-property from Sunday through Saturday, we were able to take great advantage of this very nice extra-perk. Would I go again â€“ in a heartbeat. BTW, Iâ€™ve been to the other 4.5 star rated properties (via Trip Advisor) in Calistoga and they just arenâ€™t in the same league. The only place I can compare to Calistoga Ranch for overall beauty, service, and experience is the Four Seasons on the Big Island of Hawaii. Kudos Calistoga Ranch, weâ€™ll be back ï�Š

Reviews.Title: “This place really delivers.”
Reviews.Author: rdking1998
Reviews.Content: We just returned from an amazing three days at Calistoga Ranch. We stayed in a one-bedroom Bay Forest lodge, so we had an indoor/outdoor fireplace and hot tub. We also got a lot of use from the outdoor shower, despite the cooler temperatures in the evening. The place is incredible, and the staff is top notch. The restaurant and room service are both excellent. I also had the best message of my life at the spa, which is sublime. We'd go back in a heart beat.

Reviews.Title: “most dog friendly place we've stayed at”
Reviews.Author: susienoodle
Reviews.Content: it's a wonderful, relaxing, luxurious resort. Besides the deck with fireplace, I loved the dog accommodations, beds, bowls, treats, and such a warm, welcoming atmosphere for both me and the pups. Can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “True Elegance”
Reviews.Author: findsandra
Reviews.Content: It was 6 women and we needed a getaway weekend. From the time we stepped out of our cars, till the time we returned to them (two days later) ....it was the most Amazing and Awesome experience EVER!! The reception representatives met you with true Crystal Glasses of White or Red wine, and proceeded to brag on their extravagant accommodations. We did not leave the property because it provided everything we could have possibly wanted. From the spa, to the wine cave, to the bar, to the restaurant, to our cabin with a Hot tub...we wanted for nothing. The pictures of the lodges on the Calistoga Ranch website are true to their looks, but even more beautiful by sight. All of it was elegant, from the cheese and wine welcome platter, to the in-lodge dining breakfast the next morning, to the sunset dinner at the restaurant by the fireplace. While it was expensiveâ€¦it was worth every dime. We loved it tremendously. Be careful whom you book with. Calistoga Ranch tried to change our reservation at the last minute even when it was Pre-paid. We had booked through Leading Hotels of the World who guarantees their reservations. They were able to contact the resort to get our original booking honored.

Reviews.Title: “Words Fail”
Reviews.Author: Armonk
Reviews.Content: Words Fail to capture the beauty of this property. I don't even think pictures could do it. It was spectacular. The staff was also uniformly friendly, accommodating, unpretentious and eager to assist. Five stars for them too. I will mention a couple of things that potential visitors should keep in mind. First, the property is spread over perhaps a quarter mile of a hillside. Second, all of the buildings are unconnected. So a guest must go outside to access the restaurant, the fitness center, etc. The staff will come with golf carts to transport you and you may prefer to walk. But in the colder weather that is something visitors should be aware of.Third, even the individual units the sleeping and sitting area are not connected and you have to go outside to go from one to the other. This may matter at night or in inclement weather. Fourth, the fitness center is open-air which again will matter on colder or inclement days. I was sad to leave after three days and would definitely return. It is like having a romance with a supermodel - you can't believe how beautiful she is but she has her idiosyncracies and demands that drive you crazy and you know sooner or later it is going to end but until it does you are glad just to have the time while it lasts.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful but very, very hard to justify the price”
Reviews.Author: mommythek
Reviews.Content: We were very much looking forward to our first trip to Napa, for our 20th wedding anniversary. After looking over the various travel information sources (web, magazines, friends, etc.) we thought this sounded perfect. The concierge was very helpful in setting us up with tours, restaurants, etc., but that was about as far as it went in terms of superior service. The website and videographers have done a beautiful job of selling it. In theory, private cabana/homes featuring indoor/outdoor space (hot tub, outdoor shower, indoor/outdoor fireplace, etc.) should be a wonderful thing--but it wasn't enough. The facility itself is more spartan than one would expect. The Lakehouse restaurant was almost empty and yet the service was terribly slow....the on-site facilities were stark and primitive. I know it's not a "resort," per se, but considering the price (approximately a mortgage payment per night) I expected a little more.....something.

Reviews.Title: “Truly an amazing resort”
Reviews.Author: OBmomma
Reviews.Content: What a great property to stay at !!! The rooms were beautiful and we loved having the outdoor living spaces ( the outside shower and the hot tub on our deck, which we used everyday !) The fireplace was open sided , so as you sipped wine in the hot tub under the stars you could have the fireplace on for even more ambiance. The staff was one of the best staffs we have ever encountered ( and we have stayed at many different luxury hotels across the world) Every single person was pleasant and eager to please, everyone took extra time to help you ( getting me an ice bag to keep my wine cool as we drove back to San Francisco to the spa attendants who brought me a complimentary glass of champagne because I had a stressful ballooning landing earlier in the day) . We liked using the property's selection of mercedes available instead of always using our rental car. I can not say enough about the concierge Gregory Haas, he was the BEST !!! He was able to arrange things for us prior to the trip ( french laundry reservations, winery tours and tastings) and also while we were there: from a meeting with the artist Lowell Herrero after I saw one of his paintings at a tasting room, an impromptu decision on our part to want to do an olive oil tasting ( which was scrumptious), and a cooking demonstration at the culinary institute of america . I really recommend everything about this property, it is awesome and I can not wait to visit again !!!

Reviews.Title: “Might well be the best place my wife and...”
Reviews.Author: TheRichens2
Reviews.Content: Might well be the best place my wife and I have ever stayed. Sensational service, stunning rooms, beautiful surroundings, great food. It was so hard to leave. Thanks to everyone there who made the start if our honeymoon so memorable. Just wish it wasn't so eye-wateringly expensive so we could come back every year.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort, a tad overpriced”
Reviews.Author: Rinkman
Reviews.Content: As all the reviews have said the place is beautiful. The lodges are well thought out and the furnishings to me were gorgeous. The outside shower I still miss today! Based on my headline what could they have done better....Really not a lot. Maybe include a breakfast and include the wet bar after the first day. The Lakehouse restaurant was good, the service was outstanding. I wanted to go there to experience it.....I'm glad I did. But for the price, I'll rent a bike, drive my own car, eat at Cyrus, if I desire, and stay at a few other properties that are half the price, yet provide similar lodging experiences.

Reviews.Title: “Royal Wedding”
Reviews.Author: higgins08
Reviews.Content: Recently attended my son's wedding at Calistoga Ranch. What a wonderful experience for all of us. From the ceremony conducted on the beautiful grounds to the wedding dinner in the wine cave, it was spectacular! If you are considering being married at the ranch, don't hesitate. Your wedding will be remembered by all attending along with a lifetime of memories for each of you.

Reviews.Title: “We've already booked our next stay”
Reviews.Author: BriggsCass
Reviews.Content: The Calistoga Ranch is expensive, but we loved it so much, we've already booked our second stay. You are in the middle of nature, surrounded by peace and quiet, yet surrounded by unpretentious luxury. It's close to everything wine country has to offer, and yet feels off the beaten track. Our "room" felt immense, and was actually two buildings separated by a deck (that had an oak tree growing through the middle of it!). Our deck had a hot tub, which we did not use. Because I have ridiculously sensitive hearing, we asked maintenance to disconnect the heat pump so that we could sleep with the window open and not hear the pump (which is right by the bedroom window). They were really nice about doing that for us. It was lovely to sleep with the windows open -- it felt like we were sleeping outside, being rocked to sleep by the gentle breezes. Sitting out on the deck, listening to the wind move through the trees and gazing up at the stars, was heaven. I'm sure the restaurant was great, but we didn't set foot in it, choosing instead to eat all our meals out on our deck. The two-sided fireplace was lovely to cozy up to, both inside the living room, and outside on the deck. The living room had a wet bar and powder room, and felt elegant and spacious, yet also welcoming and cozy at the same time How do they manage that? I don't know, but it was wonderful. The bed was incredibly comfortable -- down duvets and pillows, and fluffy comfiness all around. Although we travel a lot, I don't tend to sleep well in hotels, but I slept incredibly well here. The bathroom is spacious, and the outdoor shower feels private. If it is too chilly in the morning to shower outside, you can use the shower in the bathtub that separates the two sink areas. Their service was excellent -- really excellent. Everyone was extremely helpful, and went out of their way for us in the most welcoming and genuine way. We had a few small special requests to make (like the spa pump), and felt a little hesitant, not wanting to put anyone out (for instance, we requested an item off the restaurant menu to be delivered to us, instead of ordering completely off the room service menu, which is different). Everyone was incredibly kind, helping us with our requests and truly making us feel like it was no trouble at all. (I hope it really wasn't any trouble.) Sometimes in a fancy hotel, the service is good, but it feels...too fancy or formal. At CR, we felt like we were welcome guests in the home of an incredibly gracious, accommodating host. My husband and I are very lucky to be able to treat ourselves to some very nice hotels from time to time, and but we've noticed that a famous hotel name or a hefty price tag don't always guarantee comfortable beds or sometimes even basic service. The Calistoga Ranch is not just a famous name -- their reputation is well-deserved. Their establishment excels in all the categories that really matter to us, most particularly creature comforts, beauty of the location, and their truly exceptional, friendly service. We visited the property this spring, and will be back later this summer. We're sure we'll be back again and again. It's a really special place, and we feel lucky to be able to visit it.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Setting for Pure Relaxation and Experiencing the Valley”
Reviews.Author: bullet78
Reviews.Content: We had been wanting to go here for a long time and finally did so. Our high expectations were met and we cannot wait to return someday and stay longer than the 3 days we just did. The Ranch is built into the side of a gently sloping hill and is very beautiful and peaceful. You get the sense you are really able to enjoy the outdoors but it comes with an amazing room and great service to boot. The service at the Ranch is top notch. The staff at the poolside bar and restaurant are very friendly as was everybody else we met. The concierge was very helpful with our wine tastings and dinner reservations. There were nice added touches throughout, such as jelly beans left on the bed one night, or a surprise bottle of champagne and a piece of cake that came complimentary as we were celebrating an anniversary. The room was terrific. We had a one bedroom oak creek spa lodge. The bedroom and living area are separated by a large deck with a hot tub. The deck was perfect for enjoying the early morning sunshine or for lounging in front of the indoor/outdoor fireplace late at night after a great meal. We also loved the bathroom and in particular the outdoor shower. One suggestion for them on the room would be to have some more selections in the mini bar. What is in there when you arrive is complimentary which is great, but some liquor would have been a nice touch. To their credit they are very efficient with room service requests for things that aren't already in the fridge. The pool area is pretty nice, not amazing. It's a smaller pool and the ranch does seem to be popular for families with babies and small children so keep that in mind. You will probably hear kids having a good time enjoying the pool if you go. The pool does get great sun all day long and is a very nice setting, as you views of the surrounding hills and nearby vines. The spa is on the small to medium side but very peaceful just like the rest of the place. They have a couple of heated pools and a steam room that we didn't use. The food at the lakehouse restaurant was quite good. It's a lovely setting as well, set up on top of the hill with gorgeous views of a lake and the tree-covered hillside. If you dine as the sun is going down you may see the resident deer that make the place home, including a little one if you're there soon. Like the rest of the ranch the restaurant has an indoor/outdoor atmosphere, but they do have heat lamps setup for when it gets chilly. As for the food, we are lovers of great food and they had some awesome dishes on the menu. The best was an egg yolk pasta with mushrooms and braised rabbit. Frankly amazing. Some other recommendations for your time in Napa: one of the wineries we visited was Swanson, which we really enjoyed. It's a smaller place where we had a more one on one tasting with a woman that has worked there for many years in a really cool room. You have to experience it. We also love Shramsberg, the sparking wine maker. They have a great tour that we've done a couple of times now. And do try to dine at Auberge one night, the most fantastic view we saw all weekend was from their terrace. Though we were here for a short while we were both very sad to leave. This is just an amazing and beautiful place and I can't wait for our return trip. Calistoga Ranch whatever you are doing please don't stop, keep it exactly the same.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: Sarahybarey
Reviews.Content: This place is just amazing. I came with my husband for a short honeymoon and the experience was perfect. We stayed at an Oak Creek Spa Room and it was incredible. The room was so clean and the staff was amazingly helpful and willing to help with everything. The concierge, Gloria was superb. She helped us get into the French Laundry and organized an amazing wine tour. The food at the ranch was amazing and the room service was tasty and prompt. The spa was pricey but worth every penny. To sum everything up it was an amazing honeymoon experience and I would recommend this hotel for those looking for a special weekend. My only word of caution is that the ground and rooms are so wonderful you won't want to leave. We stayed on the resort property for the majority of our stay and I cried tears when I left. For those looking foir rustic romance I cannot recommend the Calistoga Ranch enough.

Reviews.Title: “Special Occasion”
Reviews.Author: dougboy
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights at the Ranch celebrating our 25th wedding anniversary. The hotel is described elsewhere and we agree with all the complimentary reviews. The concierge staff arranged a daily itinerary which ran from ballooning to the French Laundry. Wow, I hope we can do it again in another 25 years. ;-)

Reviews.Title: “A Unique and Wonderful Place!”
Reviews.Author: Intoowin
Reviews.Content: A unique and wonderful place! The Calistoga Ranch is understated, serene, and exceptionally welcoming. It is situated in a breathtaking and private canyon and it provided instant relaxation the minute we stepped foot on the property. We were greeted with champagne and the attention to service and detail continued throughout our stay. This is by far the finest accommodations weâ€™ve experienced in the Napa Valley and as far as my husband and I are concerned, the only place to stay when visiting the wine country! Every detail is thorough and gracious without ever being intrusive. The spa was lovely and the masseurs were very experienced. The stylish and spacious suites incorporate the beauty of the outdoors and are exceptionally comfortable with every amenity. The Lake House Restaurant and lounge offer some of the finest cuisine weâ€™ve experienced in the Napa Valley. Steve the bartender was certainly a highlight with his easy-going personality and unpretentious knowledge of fine wine and spirits. The Calistoga Ranch does not miss a beatâ€¦ Our experience from beginning to end was as picture perfect as the setting!

Reviews.Title: “Truly amazing”
Reviews.Author: mountainview29
Reviews.Content: I have to say that it's very hard for me to give a "5" in anything but Calistoga Ranch takes the cake in terms of the best service, luxury facilities, food, spa, and ambiance. We stayed in a spa lodge and everything from the indoor/outdoor fireplace to the turndown service to the yummy snacks (free of charge) in the fridge was delightful. Be prepared to spend a lot for this place and come with some small bills- a mistake I made when I needed to tip our driver. Who was expecting a driver to your room? Another thing to be aware of- this location is tucked away and sometimes hard to find. Give yourself a little time to get there. But go- it's worthwhile!

Reviews.Title: “Great New Years stay!”
Reviews.Author: crisdav
Reviews.Content: We just stayed 2 days at the Ranch and had a wonderful time! And we also celebrated the new years with them and had dinner at the lakehouse and was not disappointed! This is our 2nd trip to the ranch and like the time before we had a hard time leaving! We really enjoy staying there and have a hard time leaving. It is like camping with luxury all rolled into to one! They are always willing to accomodate and leave you some thing at turn down service each night. Do not miss staying here!!

Reviews.Title: “Nature meets decadence !”
Reviews.Author: Jamesharris
Reviews.Content: A perfect enviroment to embelish nature,admire flawless landscape, rejouvanate at the wonderful spa,indulge in innovative local cuisine,and be pampered if you wish by the amazing staff ! We had a wonderful experience!

Reviews.Title: “Gone to the dark side”
Reviews.Author: NY-traveller100
Reviews.Content: Must be suffering from the recession. Used to be a terrific exclusive property for adults seeking privacy and quiet. Now the pool and common areas are full of day trippers, local afternoon guests, and loud obnoxious Brits. Worst of all are the crying babies at the pool and babies swimming in diapers in the pool. Gross! Might as well go to Atlantis in the Bahamas. A joke for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: jacqueline41
Reviews.Content: We loved the Calistoga ranch. It's a beautiful place in a beautiful setting. Perfect Napa getaway!!

Reviews.Title: “Starry Nights”
Reviews.Author: quela_ann
Reviews.Content: We had an amazing time at Calistoga Ranch. The service was outstanding, the hot tub was nice and very private. I wake up earlier than my fiance, so one morning I went on one of the hiking trails that are on the property, it was really easy and had an awesome view from the top. The only downside was the spa, it could use a little updating...

Reviews.Title: “Seamless service - a perfect get-a-way!”
Reviews.Author: TorontoMango
Reviews.Content: Our experience at the Calistoga ranch was great. It was more money than we'd ever spent on a hotel - but our stay was so luxurious - we felt like it was well worth it! Every staff member there - from the valet, to the concierge, to the cleaning staff were all really professional and provided the best service. They always went out of their way to make your requests happen - they never say no! When we wanted reservations at exclusive restaurants in Yountvile - they made it happen every time! During our stay there was a "Mercedes Benz" program - where you could rent (without charge or fuel charge) top of the line Mercedes Benz cars! We drove the s550 and the CLK convertible all around the Napa Valley! There seemed to be one available - most likely because most of the people that stay at the Calistoga ranch have a car that is much more elite! But that being said - we really felt like we were treated like VIPs even though we pulled up in our rental car! What a great way to unwind from a busy month preparing for our wedding - the ranch was peaceful, serene, and a real get-a-way. Sinking into the hot tub on our private terrace, gazing at the indoor/outdoor fireplace, doing yoga looking out onto a mountain range vista - it's like something out of a magazine - but it really happened! Splurge someday and stay at the Calistoga Ranch.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific in every way.”
Reviews.Author: Jlwm0560
Reviews.Content: This hidden gem of a place is great for sleeping in late, relaxing by the pool, and enjoying fine wine on your private deck underneath the stars. The accomodations are simple but luxurious, and the design blends nicely with the natural area. It was so restful and peaceful there we didn't want to leave. Lunch by the pool was perfect: light, delicious, and healthy. Dinner at the Lakehouse was exquiste, and pre-dinner drinks at the bar were fun. While this place is top notch, the atmosphere is down to earth and friendly!

Reviews.Title: “Above all else”
Reviews.Author: Loveit78
Reviews.Content: You can't really describe this place accurately enough for those who have not stayed here. To say it is the nicest place you will ever stay just doesn't even begin to describe how amazing this place is. My boyfriend and I went there for a wine tasting trip and it was just amazing. The staff, the rooms everything is just incredible. We wanted to cry when we left it was so great we never wanted to leave. It was his first stay and my second and it was fantastic. Amazing rooms, great location and top notch staff. The minibar (no charge) is stocked with well over $200 worth of goodies and this place is just awesome. We stayed in a bay forest lodge and just loved it. The room layout is amazing and we loved that our room was was separated from the living room by a great deck with a fireplace. This is true luxury at it's finest. I would not recommend the restaurant but the room service was good. We had massages and they were amazing the spa is beautiful and relaxing. This place is so quiet, secure and awesome we never even locked our room, there wasn't a need to (by the way I'm from L.A. and live in Vegas so I'm not from one of those places where people don't lock their doors). Hands down the most relaxing vacation I have ever had and I hope to return very soon. 5 stars is not enough for this place. It is very expensive but I thought worth every penny so that is why I rated value high. I'm not delusional about the fact that most people would not be able to afford this but if you can it is well worth the splurge.

Reviews.Title: “This is THE place to unwind”
Reviews.Author: Rt7Grill
Reviews.Content: In my many years of travel & staying at 4 & 5 star hotels, I've never had better service! The staff at Calistoga Ranch is ready & able to make your stay about fulfilling fantasies... it was my wife's 40th birthday & we arrived to our amazing room with a chocolate cake waiting for us & happy birthday wishes. My 4 year old son & I wanted to go for a bike ride & they scoured the property & within minutes found a trailer to hitch onto the bike so we could go for a nice long bike ride (water, oranges, maps, etc. constantly are being offered). We had free use of a Mercedes 550 sedan for the day - unheard of! - just because I asked about the cars they had up front.
