These are just the minor details but being whisked around on golf carts all over the property & having items (movies, shampoo, room service, news paper) also delivered in moments - truly unbelievable service. The rooms (we had a hot tub on a deck connecting the 2 rooms, they are all private "suites") were lovely with great proprietary bath products, natural wood, fantastic sheets, pillows, etc,.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel.”
Reviews.Author: N6812T
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at Calistoga Ranch a couple of times now. The property is gorgeous. The staff is unobtrusive. The spa is wonderful. The food is average, go elsewhere. There are too many great options in the valley. We will return every year that we can afford it.

Reviews.Title: “Heavenly...”
Reviews.Author: dancingnancy
Reviews.Content: Yes, heavenly. Even in the cold rain of December. Even though scores of shingled units are packed into this cozy out-of-the way valley, just off the Silverado Trail, it maintains a sense of seclusion and privacy. Even though the front desk and pool are a half mile in one direction and the dining room and spa are a half mile in the other, the service is efficient and cheerful, as youâ€™re zipped from one end to the other in a fleet of golf carts. That is, if you can tear yourself away from your own room. The concept here is to blur the line between indoors and out. The construction and landscaping is impressive. Itâ€™s engaging to see how trees were spared by simply jogging decks and buildings around them. We enjoyed a dinner and two breakfasts at the Lakehouse. My massage and mudbath were also fabulous, if incredibly pricey. The spa, as a whole, was lovely and a wonderful retreat. Our room had only an outdoor shower (and huge indoor tub). I was a little dubious, but the showerhead was gigantic, and even in the pouring winter rain, or maybe because of it, it was blissful. Bath amenities were wonderful and plentiful. Lots of towels, beautiful bed linens. Wireless internet everywhere. An engaging and uplifting place to spend some time. That said, it would be nice if a network of walking paths connected the various guest areas. Walking along a blacktop road, dodging golf carts is at odds with the rest of the experience. There are two hiking trails, however, which we were not intrepid enough to try in the downpour.

Reviews.Title: “Pure Bliss”
Reviews.Author: Canuck14
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent three magnificent days at Calistoga in early December. If one is looking for discreet and elegant, this place is it. Calistoga is tucked away in a small side valley in Napa. The suites are gorgeous, comfortable and provide a serene and pampered escape that you'll never forget. Althought the mornings were cool, I enjoyed the private outdoor shower and during the sunny afternoons, we had the pool to ourselves. The Lakehouse restaurant was sublime, serving exquisitely prepared meals. Paired with a great wine list and attentive but not obtrusive service, Lakehouse got tops marks from us. The highlight of a world class resort ultimately comes from your interaction with the staff and how they handle the small details. On our second night, we were told the restaurant would be closed for the staff Christmas party. No big deal to us, Napa has many great restaurants to explore. Yet the resort thought of it to prepare a "Goodie Basket" as they called it. Well some basket. It included amazing gourmet turkey club sandwiches, a mixed green salad, cheese tray and an excellent bottle of chilled chardonnay. After that nice touch I just had to light up one of my fine Cubans (yes I'm a Canadian and we have no issues with Castro!) and sat outside on our patio, fired up the outdoor fire place and gazed the the millions of stars twinkling overhead. Calistoga Ranch is first class.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!!”
Reviews.Author: Shannum
Reviews.Content: I really do not have the words to describe what an amazing place Calistoga Ranch is! The lodges are so nice and relaxing (we were on the porch with the fire on every single night), you barely know anyone else is around and the service was on point (we especially loved the cold waters waiting for us in the car every time the valet brought it up). We got there the day after our wedding and were relaxed within minutes. The room was more than spacious and clean. The spa was relaxing and nice even just to sit on their porch and enjoy life. The location is perfect â€“ far enough away to be secluded but close enough to shops, wineries and restaurants for when you need them. We are already saving money to go back for an anniversary in the future!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: travelerkl
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend Calistoga Ranch for a romantic, upscale getaway. The resort offers superb service, amazing rooms and lovely grounds. The food in the restaurant was terrific. Note that there's a set dinner menu each night which offers unique selections, so for those picky eaters, I would ask the waiter for the room service menu. The outdoor spa is lovely. The treatment rooms are private, but the common areas such as the jacuzzi and sitting area are out in the open and on a nice day, it's very refreshing. The ranch is tucked in the valley so it does get very hot in the summer (when we were there it was 105). Be sure to bring a swim suit as the pool is a nice place to relax and soak in the peace and tranquility of Calistoga.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It”
Reviews.Author: Blank10
Reviews.Content: This place is fantastic. You'll definitely drop some serious dollars here but you get what you pay for. Top notch service, exclusive setting, great food and a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Place to Get Away from It All”
Reviews.Author: blunistgirl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I only stayed one night, but wished we could stay all week! I have the pleasure of staying at many luxury resorts throughout the country due to business, and this was easily one of the best resorts I've stayed at. It is definitely more enjoyable for couples as a romantic getaway. I agree the separate living room/kitchen from the bedroom building is weird, but we embraced our "outdoor living room." Loved that the mini-bar was stocked with a number of great treats, including a bottle of wine, beer, soft drinks, juices, organic granola bars, chocolate to pair with red wines, water, etc....and ALL COMPLIMENTARY. I've never come across this, and it was a great touch. Everything you might need is in your room. The deck is truly perfect for your outdoor living space, and the hot tub was a fantastic way to really wind down. I loved waking up in the morning, finding myself in the middle of what seemed to be the middle of the wilderness, and enjoying coffee and the paper on the loungers without going anyway. Cream, Splenda....just how I like it...and I never make coffee in my room, but this made me want to. The outdoor shower was fantastic, but there is an indoor shower and huge bathroom w/tub as well if that is what you prefer. Loved that they had a variety of complimentary activities and hiking trails that you can take advantage of. Wish they offered yoga or pilates each morning...not the morning we were there, but oh well. The pool was nice, not huge, but had a nice little pool bar and attendants as well. The only thing that was lacking is the service considering the price of rooms. Front desk was friendly, but although we arrived at 3pm, we had to wait about 10 minutes for our room. Valet was also lacking in service for a luxury hotel. We tested them about 3 times. Had to go to the Fairmont a few nights later for a meeting and thought...THIS is what a luxury hotel's valet service is supposed to be like. They need to work on that. They also offer a good variety of unique spaces to host special dinners and events if that is something you might be looking for. All in all...Can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Resort! Top Notch!”
Reviews.Author: faxdoctor
Reviews.Content: This place is incredible! The setting is literally in the woods and nature abounds. They have taken a lot of effort to keep things in the original natural state. We stayed in unit 129 and had ample privacy. The hot tub in the deck was excellent and clean. The room was very well appointed and house keeping came twice a day. Yes the layout was a little "Different" with the two seperate rooms but it really was not that big of an issue. It did have some benefit as well (One of us could stay up late and watch TV without annoying the other one that wanted to get some sleep). The food at the Lakehouse restaurant is excellent and the entire staff is A+ . Everyone went out of their way to make our time there the best it could be. Plus if you tell the local Wineries you are staying at the Ranch you get some extra special treatment from the wine people as well!

Reviews.Title: “Our room lacked privacy. Not what we expected.”
Reviews.Author: clc0501
Reviews.Content: We just stayed there last week (June 2008). The grounds, service, food and amenities were outstanding. Service was seamless and everyone makes you feel comfortable and special. The rooms, in my opinion are not that special. We paid $1100 per night, which is nearly double what we normally pay but it was a special anniversary. The rooms are actually portables, because they are not allowed to build on the land. It used to be a campground. The bedroom and living room are separate units (you walk though your patio to get from one to the other which is not a huge deal in warm weather but I would imagine it to be inconvenient in cold or wet weather!). They are very nicely appointed, but still, they are portables. At first we just thought that the architecture was odd, but then we realized why. My biggest complaint was lack of privacy in our unit. It's very rustic - we had a nice outdoor shower on one side of our patio and a jacuzzi on the other, but could hear other guests talking just one the other side of the fence, and had golf carts buzzing by our bedroom window - all day and evening. It was room 111 which is in between the two access roads (no cars allowed but plenty of cart traffic and some foot traffic). I would consider staying again if I were in a secluded room, but I don't think I'd pay that kind of money for it. There are other places in Napa that are just as nice, offering privacy and views in the premium price range.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible experience”
Reviews.Author: LLTS
Reviews.Content: This place is top notch. Superior service, food, rooms, spa. We did not want to leave to visit any of the wineries. We spent 4 days and 3 nights at the ranch and it was an unforgettable experience.

Reviews.Title: “Understated elegance in the mountains!”
Reviews.Author: montsalasmark
Reviews.Content: What an incredble experience! Not just a beautiful property, but the staff truly made our stay unforgettable. Upon checking in, I was given a bone-shaped name tag for my dog saying "I'm a guest of the Calistoga Ranch" with the phone number on it too. Such a small thing but something I'll never forget. The Lake Lodge was elegant; the bed one of the most comfortable I've ever slept on. Dinner in the Lakehouse restaurant a not to be missed experience. Expertly served by Renee and Daniel, the food rivaled anything in Europe; just delicious. A must stay for couples looking for that one special romantic place. Kudos to the Calistoga Ranch! you know how to make it happen.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, relaxed elegance”
Reviews.Author: kippergirl
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful property with some of the very best service we have ever experienced at a hotel (and we've stayed at wonderful places). The setting is very remote so that you feel you are completely away from it all. There are 2 areas on the property where rooms are located -- one is close to the entrance/pool/exercise area. The other is close to the restaurant/spa area. We were in the restaurant/spa area and we would highly recommend staying there as you can walk to dinner or a yoga class at the spa. It's quite a trek from one area to the next so most people use the golf cart service that is provided. The service was extremely quick -- with never more than a 3 to 5 minute wait. The restaurant is absolutely terrific and well-priced for the quality and service. We ate there two (out of 4) nights because the food and setting was so good. We would also recommend contacting the concierge to set up wine tastings before your trip. Gloria set up some wonderful itineraries for us to some wineries that are far off the beaten track and that are only available by appointment. Overall, a great place with no negatives.

Reviews.Title: “Worth every $”
Reviews.Author: SodaSanFran
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful New Year's Eve at the Calistoga Ranch! The manager event sent bubbly & cupcakes to all the rooms, a nice touch. VERY pet friendly - which is why I initially chose this hotel for our special evening. The staff was very helpful & courteous. Pure luxury & highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Great, but...”
Reviews.Author: pcc_travel
Reviews.Content: - No cell service for AT&T except in a small patch outside the restaurant. - Free Internet (wired and wireless) - Free non alcoholic beverages in the room - Rooms very very small - Staff very helpful - Small property so you dont run into other guests that much.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy Deluxe”
Reviews.Author: RLA
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Calistoga Ranch in the prime autumn time when the foliage was brilliant, there was just enough crisp in the air to require a sweater, and during the grape crush when you can smell a faint grape scent circulating in the air around certain parts of the valley. This is such a romantic and cozy time to come to this region. Calistoga Ranch seems to be perfectly located in Napa Valley; easy drives to literally dozens of wineries (both Napa and Sonoma). At the Ranch, everything is new and modern, but maintains a rustic, "outdoorsy" charm. There is no shortage of wood burning fireplaces, both outdoors and indoors, with ample sitting space which makes for perfect wine-sipping, book-reading, or time spent just catching up with friends in a really great setting. The property is very spread out, which means calling the golf cart butlers pretty much every time you need to go anywhere... they are usually there in a matter of a couple minutes to take you anywhere you need to go on the property. Located at the base of the property near the lobby, the hotel pool and hot tub is quite stunning and there appears to be enough lounge chairs for everyone (all very nice quality). The fitness facility is half indoors and half outdoors (overlooking the hotel pool) and is really impressive - everything you could want. They have a wide variety of cardio machines, each with their own personal TV, and ample weight lifting machines as well. All equipment is new and state-of-the art; again, *very* impressive fitness facilities. Located on top of the hill of the property (take a golf cart if you're tired!) is the hotel spa. We unfortunately didn't have time to check out the services, but we heard from friends that everything about it was fantastic. For our accommodations, we had one of the least expensive "lodge rooms" (all are separate structures); room 136, which was about $750 or so per night (yes, a definite splurge). Our room had a nice large front porch with outdoor fireplace and outdoor furniture which was a really great touch (they hang your morning paper on the door to your porch each morning). Our actual lodge interior was divided in two main spaces: half for the beautiful large bathroom with his and hers sinks and a nice closet and half for the bedroom. This division of space seemed a bit odd as the bedroom was pretty tiny and cramped (but still very nice and well appointed). The bed was great; fantastic linens -- we slept quite well. One of the best things about our lodge (and every lodge, we believe) is the huge outdoor 'rain forest' shower. It's completely private and there are towel hooks and a place for the *amazing* Calistoga bath products...this shower experience is truly one of the best things about each lodge, especially when it's a little cold out. If you're not into it, never fear as there is a regular shower and bath inside each lodge, as well. Room 136 is especially nice if you're attending a wedding at Calistoga as the reception Wine Cave and the main hotel restaurant are literally 20 feet from your doorstep. All in all, a very nice lodge, but the living/sleeping quarters were definitely cramped. The only meals we ate at Calistoga were breakfasts and they were a solid 9 out of 10. Service at the restaurant was great and the ambiance and view overlooking the valley of Calistoga was beautiful. NB: order up a plate of "well done crispy bacon" and you won't regret it. Service, in general, at Calistoga was a solid 9 out of 10. They lost half a point in two areas: a) again, because the property is so vast (and steep), you'll need to rely on the golf cart drivers to take you from here to there...they are usually timely, but about a third of our calls for a ride took several minutes which was a little frustrating (perhaps they were understaffed?) and b) the friends we were traveling with had a frustrating check-in process...their room wasn't ready when we arrived (the hotel check-in time is technically 4:00...however, because the rest of the wedding party's rooms were ready, this was also frustrating and it would have been nice if the hotel offered them a complimentary glass of wine or something to ease the blow after a 6 hour flight and 2 hour drive). The Ranch did have a very high standard of service in all other areas and one to make special note of would be the concierge staff. Greg, in particular, helped line us up with a wonderful wine tour of Quintessa, Opus and Clos du Val chauffeured by "Gia," with a stop at the Oakville Grocery Store and it was a very memorable day (NB: Ask Greg to mention another winery called "Constant;" it's also one of his favorites and sounds spectacular). All in all, we are very happy with our choice to stay at Calistoga Ranch for this trip to Napa. The other super luxe resort in this region would be Calistoga's sister property, the famous Auberge du Soleil, about 20 minutes from Calistoga, which is also supposed to be fabulous [NB: For those not wanting to spend quite so much, I'd highly recommend checking out The Villagio Inn & Spa 10 minutes away in Yountville, where I have also stayed -- beautiful property at a much lower price point].

Reviews.Title: “Expensive but well worth it”
Reviews.Author: sandan93
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Ranch 10/5-10/8. The setting was absolutely gorgeous, They have new construction going on but do all they can to hide it from view and being there over weekend no work was going on. The rooms are wonderful. We stayed in the Oak Creek lodge units with separate bedroom unit w/ bath and outdoor shower ( great seeing steam rise up early in morning) Living room with 1/2 bath and indoor outdoor fireplace was set set up great. Personal hot tub was just right after a night of great food and wine. The Lakehouse restaurant has terrific service wonderful food and a beautiful setting. The valet staff were the most attentive and courteous we have ever encountered, traveling around grounds is done by cart, they were available at a moments notice and even have blankets for those chilly night rides. Room service arrived hot as if you were eating in a restaurant and was delicious (How often does that happen?)We have traveled to many first class destinations and stayed in some of the best hotels in the world, but staying here is definitely near the top of our list. If you can afford it, stay at least for a couple of nights. Also, their proximity to Calistoga and St. Helena is only minutes away. We will surely be staying here again next time we are in the valley.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: sfjimmy27
Reviews.Content: Very unique setting and property. Restaurant was fantastic and the rooms were very comfortable and very tastefully appointed. The outdoor living room with fireplace was fantastic for a romantic fall stay. It was very quiet and the outdoor work-out facility/pool was great. Not sure what it would be like at capacity because it wasn't very large. Staff fantastic. Looking for something out of the ordinary, this is great find.

Reviews.Title: “Well worth the $$$”
Reviews.Author: LAtravelfan
Reviews.Content: Calistoga is an amazing place and well worth the price. Our room was outstanding...bright and fresh with a ridiculously cozy & comfortable bed. Our room was so private. we just looked out into endless trees and landscape.. you didn't even notice any other rooms around you. waking up in the morning and looking out into the beautiful Calistoga hills from our bed was a treat! The outdoor shower is the same way....you could just look up staring at the trees forever. The Lakehouse restaurant is one of the best meals I have ever had...with a very romantic outdoors location. we lingered there for 3 hours just enjoying the moment. Overall lodge staff is attentive without being overbearing...every time we called for a golf cart ride they arrived within less than a minute and were always SO friendly. well-appointed workout room is fabulous. they also have biking and running trail maps for you in the room so the first morning I ran along some beautiful wineries. And the concierge staff was immensely helpful, pikcing out some amazing restaurants that perfectly matched our style (and budget!) I really can't think of a single thing wrong with Calistoga. it was SO relaxing, private and luxurious. I'm already dreaming of going back in the fall/winter as I can imagine it is even more amazing in the fall weather!

Reviews.Title: “wow”
Reviews.Author: hartdot
Reviews.Content: It is the best of calif and napa. It is such a pleasant property..quiet/nature all around you but the best conveniences one could want//// The rooms are wonderfully appointed, the food great.. the pool and work-out area out there in nature...the ambience of the resort is amazing

Reviews.Title: “Best days of my life”
Reviews.Author: Always4travel
Reviews.Content: This resort was as close to heaven as you can get. The property is gorgeous and left natural enough to be really special. The Bay Lodge we stayed in was awesome. The outdoor shower was so much fun that we got up early just to enjoy the steam rising since the air was still cool. The wireless internet access on the deck area was free and super for sending e-mails home to make everyone jealous. We were not planning to bring our dog but circumstances were such that she came. She was treated like royalty with a special bed, bowls and collar tag waiting when we got to the room. The service was impeccable and we wanted for nothing. We were not sure what to expect but decided to try CR. We will be back!!

Reviews.Title: “Quaint Location, Nice for a Special Occasion, but construction going on”
Reviews.Author: judyf
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights (Sun, Mon, Tues) for our anniversary and booked the 'starry night package' which includes a dinner for two, massage for two and stay in the deluxe lodge room. This is close to a 5 star resort with only few problems to correct. However, their main problem cannot be easily corrected as they are under major construction to add more private owned 'rooms.' I would suggest that they find time in the fall & winter to work longer shifts than during high season of summer. We were in room 124 which was far enough away from the construction but we were located next to a bridge which you could hear the golf carts traveling over (even at 10:30 at night.) The Pros - very friendly staff, always had our car started, top down with cold bottles of water inside, and/or air conditioning running. The restaruant 4 course meal with the package was one of the finest we have ever had. Again the staff was very good and the restaraunt was quiet that evening. We also received a dessert from the chief with 'Happy Anniversary' spelled out in choclate on the plate . The grounds were impecable with bikes to use for free, hiking paths and bocci ball. The rooms with the connecting deck and outdoor furniture was very unique. The beds and towels were fluffy and the outdoor shower was incredible. The decor and audio systems were very nice. The indoor/outdoor fireplace and private hot tub on the deck was also very nice and used often. Our room was ready when we arrived at 4:00 (although we heard other people's rooms were not) - an hour after arrival we received a complimentary bottle of champagne and dessert for our anniversary. All room service was quick and accurate and food is great. Fridge was stocked daily with complementary beverages and bottle of wine. Room service very good. Cons - the outdoor furnture cushions were very stained/dirt. There were many young kids in the pool all day when we were at the pool - for $1300/night I don't want high pitched screams and splashing. The service at the pool (on Monday afternoon) lacked severly, young kids serving - very disapointing. I was very annoyed when the waiter at the pool was pushing us to finish our food and sign the bill by 5:30 when the pool service is open until 6:00. We had to go to the bar 2/3 times to get our drinks. Much traffic on the main path through the resort to the restaurant during the day. Some servers to the room didn't speak much english. Next to the bed there was a breakfast order menu of which we filled out every evening and hung by the door. At check out we find out that we are charged for the breakfast - and there were no prices listed on the order menu!! We figured breakfast was included in the $1300/night fee. I told the front staff repeatedly that you cannot offer breakfast service/any menu showing no prices and make customers pay - but they didn't do anything. All other dinner and beverage menus in the rooms showed prices. All in all one of the top resorts we have been to - we have been to Broadmoor, Peter Island, Ritz-Carlton... We really like the Calistoga area and will return to the area but not the Calistoga Ranch until construction is finished or they offer very reduced rates. We were one of the lucky ones that weren't directly affected.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, unique, luxurious”
Reviews.Author: hoteljunkies
Reviews.Content: We stayed just one night. Smiles aplenty by the staff. Very friendly and willing to help. Did I mention smiles? Overall I enjoyed the stay. I loved the decor of the units, but thought the separation of the living room from the bedroom was unnecessary. It was nice to have a complimentary honor bar (non-alcoholic items were free). I loved the outdoor shower - very romantic. The restaurant served excellent food. The spa massage therapists were awesome - very knowledgeable and caring to your needs. The restaurant and spa are supposedly for resort guests only, which keeps the priority for the guests. What I didn't like was how our deck faced the front of the units, and not in the back like I had imagined. Also, the bedroom windows were large but also faced the front. That lack of privacy was a little disappointing. It kind of defeated the purpose for me and for why I paid the high rates. Another problem for me, which wasn't major, was that I didn't know that the resort was pet-friendly until I got there. I have allergies to certain animals. Although our room did not appear to have any animal hair or odor, many pet owners did not keep the animals on a leash and think that everyone is ok with that. I have kids, but I still don't like when people don't control their children. Why should pets be any different. Not everyone is comfortable with animals, especially when allergies are involved. I would stay there again, but only if I got a substantially reduced rate.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but construction and noise ruin even the nicest room experiences”
Reviews.Author: ChrisGAnnapolis
Reviews.Content: We were very disappointed with this, our second visit to Calistoga Ranch. We booked the most expensive accomodations at the resort for two evenings and were placed in the Creek room closest to the bridge to the active construction area. We were livid to wake to the beeps of backing construction equipment, the rumble of large trucks across the bridge and, worst of all, a bulldozer left idling unattended outside our bedroom window, still on the "guest" side of the bridge. Needless to say this was completely unacceptable and would never happen at another resort of Calistoga's quality and price range, Post Ranch Inn for example. To the resort's credit, they gave us an extra 30 minutes on our massages and moved us to the Estate Lodge for the second of our two nights, which we appreciated, but the point of coming to Calistoga is to relax and not have to be bothered with the outside world for a day or two. Unfortunately, on this visit, I still found myself having to resort to very direct conversations with senior people at the resort before a very obvious problem was resolved that should never have occurred in the first place. We were disappointed on our first visit to the resort with the noise and traffic outside our room on the high side of the road and so we booked at the creek side (at a higher price), only to find ourselves closer to the lodge construction. We won't return, if ever, until construction is complete. Bottom line is the resort needs to seriously reexamine its approach to noise and traffic, including truck traffic past the lodges to the restaurant. Until then, you can do much better pretty much anywhere for $1000 per night.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed impression”
Reviews.Author: northerncalifornia71
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a three night stay at Calistoga Ranch. Bottom line: this is a nice enough property, but for $1100. per night we expected much, much more. Pros: The design of the room was basically pleasing, with finishes in slate and wood that are very complementary to the canyon. The outdoor shower in particular was a real treat...very relaxing. I agree with another posting that the furniture is rather standard, with the one exception being the very comfortable bed. The spa is excellent, with a nice open-air layout and well-placed soaking pools and lounge chairs. I had a massage and facial, and the facial was outstanding. Sharon has excellent skills and is highly knowledgeable about organic products. The Lakehouse restaurant is very good. Nice design and decor, friendly staff. Menu somewhat limited for a vegetarian, but our meal was excellently prepared and presented. Excellent valet service...our car was pulled up quickly with our advance call and valets always helpful. Cons: The layout of the property is reminiscent of a condominium complex, with "units" closely spaced and a non-high-end/homogenous look and feel. Not offensive, but not especially pleasing....strange choices, given all the design options available today. This could be relatively unnoticeable if the property was committed to outstanding service and attention to detail, but the staff has not trained at high enough standards to overcome the limitations in layout and design. We had specifically asked for a room with a nice view, and ended up with a view of the golf cart path up the center of the property. Not only was this less than pleasing, but we could easily hear the constant flow of cart traffic as well as continual conversations among the housekeeping and room service staff. Really disruptive if you would like to hear the birds or just enjoy some quiet. We asked to move immediately upon arrival and were told it was not possible due to high occupancy. No affirmation was given of our original request for a view, and in fact we were emphatically reminded that our confirmation indicated a Forest room vs. a Creek room and that basically we should have known that a Forest room doesn't have a comparable view. Disappointing reaction from the staff, to say the least. And no follow up on the subject on subsequent nights; no offer to move toward the end of the weekend. Any gesture from management would have been appreciated. Again, this is an $1100. per night experience. The living room furniture was downright uncomfortable. We like to end the day with a glass of wine and a chat, maybe a little reading, and we found ourselves shifting constantly due to the uncomfortable sofa and chair. Towels were very rough...noticeably so. I am surprised that this still stands out in my mind! Room service breakfast was high quality but inferior in service/delivery. On two of the three mornings we ordered meals, we had to call back for corrections that were not minor. Staff should have better training in response time and English language. The hot water kettle in our bar did not function correctly, and no replacement was given after three separate requests during our stay. Also, we repeatedly asked for extra ginger ale in our minibar, but none ever materialized. The housekeeper arrived once while we were there to restock the minibar, but the dispatcher had not taken the time to distinguish between our specific request and a basic restocking request. Furthermore, the housekeeper told us we could only have one can of ginger ale at a time. More training is obviously needed in this area. Service at the pool area is very spotty, nonexistent as the day progresses past mid afternoon. Dirt was tracked into our living room on several occasions...looked like coffee grounds, and immediately noticeable upon our return to the room in the afternoons. Lastly, and in our opinion likely indicative of the overall management philosophy, there was no action on behalf of the management or staff that made us feel especially acknowledged or welcomed. Everyone was basically friendly, but we left feeling like a more thoughtful reception and experience can be had at your standard Ritz or Four Seasons, not to mention similarly priced Northern California properties like the Post Ranch Inn in Big Sur. We had given some personal details during the reservation process that easily could have been acted upon to make our experience better than average. And the overall service could have been so much better. Disappointing

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Meal”
Reviews.Author: Cinderella_Dearest
Reviews.Content: I had an incredible dinner at The Lake House at Calistoga Ranch. The service was outstanding. My waitress, Hilary was attentive, charming, professional and made sure I had everything I wanted promptly in ther most gracious manner. The food was great, both in taste and presentation; the dining room and its views are beautfiul, and I can't recommend this place for dinner enough !

Reviews.Title: “Oasis in Wine Country”
Reviews.Author: besita74
Reviews.Content: I have visited the property before but did not stay there. I thought it was going to be nice but I didn't realize how much I would love it!! The cottage was very large and modern, and the balcony with a whirlpool was perfect for enjoying the fireplace and sitting outside in the tranquil setting. The outdoor shower - how cool is that? HEAVEN. The service was phenomenal as well. Everyone was courteous and relaxing. The restaurant experience was lovely as well- delicious (not 5 star but good). If you go you will not want to leave! Trust me, I want to buy there.

Reviews.Title: “Overpromises, Underdelivers - save your money”
Reviews.Author: mrfrancophile
Reviews.Content: I more than hate to dis a place that others love, but I have to inject some realism here about Calistoga Ranch. My wife and I love travel. We love Inns and we love B&B's and we love Hotels. We've stayed in cheapo hotels that we've loved and we've stayed in luxury hotels that we've loved. The key, I believe, to loving a restaurant or hotel or shop is value. We can love a $2 taco at El Metate like we love the $18 foie gras at Gary Danko...but if El Metate's tacos were $18 or Gary Danko's foie appetizer were $50 we'd say "What the...?" This was our problem with Calistoga Ranch. Value for the money. At $200/night, our stay would have been fabulous. At their prices, it was an outrage. It all started off well enough...(wavy blur as we experience a flashback). On their web site, the rooms sounded amazing. The private "spa" lodges offer 1200 sq. ft. of space, indoor-outdoor fireplaces off the living room, a private deck w/a hot tub and a bedroom w/a huge bath and an outdoor shower. Wow! Sounds amazing, huh? We thought so. Perhaps even enough so to warrant the $800+ per-night rate. This was our anniversary and we were excited to go there. We'd been planning it for a while and I had even spoken with the sommelier at their restaurant, The Lakehouse, days in advance to request that they bring two glasses of champagne to the table right after we were seated at our dinner there, the night we arrived. This was just a little surprise gesture for my wife. When we arrived, the property looked amazing. You cross a pretty wooden bridge and drive up to their lodge-like office, built of natural wood and stone, with a lovely outdoor lounge area with a roaring wood fire, drinks, and newspapers available. The property is valet-only, so we had to leave our car and be driven in a golf cart to our room...which we declined since our room was perhaps 100 feet from the office door. The valet staff were responsive, pleasant, and helpful and one gentleman brought our bags to the room and showed us around our lodge. Walking in the gate to our lodge, you enter the deck, with a trellis overhead and dividing the indoor living room space to the left and the bedroom space to the right. The deck was spacious and looked out over trees - very peaceful. The hot tub was over by the right edge of the deck, right outside the door to the bedroom. Sounds romantic, huh? Well, the hot tub was private, in that only we had keys to our room, but it looked out over three other lodges and right below the open railing next to the hot tub was the Ranch's Bocce Court. Private? Are we going to get naked and frolick in our "private" tub while other guests wave from their lodges or toss the bocce balls below us and wink knowingly? I don't think so. Large room.......check Private deck.......well, there's a deck, but it's not private Private hot tub...well, there's a tub, but it's definitely not private What next? Oh yeah, the fireplace. There was an indoor-outdoor fireplace, but it was both completely behind glass on both sides and was strictly a gas fireplace. Don't get me wrong. I'm not against gas fireplaces. They're great at the Lodge at Sonoma for $179/night or Santa Fe's Inn of the Anasazi at $250/night, but for $800/night, I'd expect a real, wood-burning fireplace. Gas just doesn't say "top-of-the-line". The furniture in the rooms was simple and pleasant, but more Marriott than Auberge. The floors in the bedroom creaked and squeaked - something you'd expect in a 100 year-old B&B but not in a newly-built lodge that charges more than any other hotel in wine country. The heating system blew so loudly that we had trouble sleeping at night - a contrast with the Hotel Andalucia in Santa Barbara where we stayed a few weeks later (for about a quarter the price) and where the HVAC system was so quiet we had to check to make sure that it was on. The DVD player in the bedroom, which my wife tried to use for her yoga DVD, rattled like an idling Harley motorcycle and failed to deliver an image to the screen...something they might have checked out before we checked in. The food, both at their restaurant and in the room (for breakfast), was excellent. Kudos to their kitchen. But when we did go to their restaurant for dinner...the champagne that I had requested from the sommelier for when we sat down was conspicuously absent. I didn't want to remind them at the time because the gesture was all about having thought of it ahead of time, not at the moment. No big deal. But at the end of the meal, after having ordered glasses of white, red and dessert wines, they brought the Champagne. Arrunnnhhh? What was up with that? Who has Champagne at the end of the meal? And was this the champagne I had requested or some oddly-timed gesture of the house? We checked our detailed bill upon checkout and...yep, they charged us for the champagne that didn't come when we had requested it and did come after we were done with the meal. On the bright side, they didn't argue when we asked that they take it off the bill when we explained that it didn't come when requested - we were just sad that in such an expensive and highly-rated hotel that the gaff should have happened in the first place. My wife tried their spa and felt that it did deliver on its pricey promise...even to the point of being extraordinary. Since you can go there without staying at the hotel, perhaps that's the ticket. Net net...this is an attractive hotel that would be a "perfect" getaway in wine country for $300/night. At $800/night, it's a ripoff. There are dozens of places with real fireplaces and lovely views at half the price. Save your money and get yourself a dinner at the French Laundry.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place to chill after a busy holiday”
Reviews.Author: nunwin
Reviews.Content: The Calistoga ranch is wonderful and certainly the best hotel I have stayed in, in the USA. Whilst normally travelling on holiday to the Far East rather than the USA we normally stay in the Banyan Tree or Four Seasons type resorts. The calistoga ranch certainly matches the levels of service offered at these top hotels. The rooms are fantastic and certainly large enough to relax comfortably in. The lounges in each room have your own fire place which is great to come back and chill out next too whilst watching a dvd with and drinking a glass of wine. The restaurant is excellent as is the great wine list however if staying more than a few nights the menu choices could be a bit limiting although if asked i am sure the chef would cook whatever you wanted. However there is also a great choice of restaurants in the local village of Calistoga to choice from. The spa is superb with a great selection of treatments. This is a top class chill out hotel and we will be hopefully be back again one day.

Reviews.Title: “Poorly planned expensive resort”
Reviews.Author: sjrbt
Reviews.Content: This resort has all the potential for a world class resort and none of it is even close to being realized. The planning of the resort is perplexing--they look like army barracks on the outside with a $700+ per night price tag. The resort is definately off the beaten path---if you want to be away from it ALL--you'll love it here. The separate bedroom/living area is also poorly planned. The rooms are private bungalow type rooms---the bedroom and bath building are separated by a semi-covered patio from the living room area. In rain or cold--it is ridiculous to go back and forth. The resort is a tangled web of paths around the resort which most of the time require a golf cart to get around (especially if the weather is not agreeable). The golf carts take forever to get to you. The staff is a bit snotty--especially the staff at the restaurant--we didn't even eat there because they were so unwelcoming. I apologize for not remembering names, however, a female conceige was horrible. A male conceirge, on the other hand, was fabulous and possibly the nicest one we've ever dealt with. He was the only bright spot in the staff. Room service was slow and the food was marginal. The workout area was outside--while nice if it's 70 degrees out but unbearable in the cold or heat. We were there in the rain and the wood floor of the workout area was drenched (it does have a ceiling and 3 walls (the 4th wall is totally open). I thought we'd kill ourselves walking on the slippery floor. I do not recommend this resort---your money would be better spent elsewhere. Everything appears luxurious, however, it has so many problems you'll be sick over what you spent here.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous luxurious accomodation if you can spend the $$$”
Reviews.Author: aitravel
Reviews.Content: We stayed here when we were getting married. Service is impeccable! The hotel is set in a great natural setting. To say the accomodations are great would be an understatement. The outdoor shower is amazing; closet space is perfect; the bed, the sheets, and the pillows were nothing short of luxurious. The deck was perfect for lounging outside at night with a glass of wine, looking up at the stars and hearing the crickets chirp. The living room is in a separate area from the bedroom and had its own bar area and its own powder room. The spa treatments were wonderful! Perfect getaway if money is no matter.

Reviews.Title: “Nature At Its Best”
Reviews.Author: Breckdaddy
Reviews.Content: We recently spent 2 nights and 3 days at the Calistoga Ranch and it wasn't enough! We would have loved to stay longer! My wife and I are frequent travelers and as much as we don't like to admit it...we're total hotel snobs. We use tripadvisor all the time when making reservations and this site didn't let us down again. We've stayed at another Auberge resort (Palmetto Bluff--also amazing!) and we were very excited. We pulled up to the property and we loved the fact that it was very removed from one of the main roads. We arrived with an extra guest and could no longer stay in one of the deluxe rooms--the staff was very accomodating and found a one bedroom suite so that we could all stay comfortably. The room wasn't ready, but our pre-arranged driver for wine tasting was--so off we went! When we finished our tasting tour with Bob from Prestige Limo--we were escorted to our lodge with a glass of complimentary wine in one hand and the most delicious hot chocolate in the other. We arrived at our lodge, which was made up of two separate cottages, at night. Both cottages were beautiful with a shared deck and an indoor/outdoor fireplace. The den cottage had a pull -out sofa (which was extremely comfortable for a pull-out), bar with complimentary everything except the hard liquor and beer, and a half bath. The other cottage had a king-size bed that was uber-comfortable and a great, huge bathroom (plus outdoor rain shower that was awesome!). We were even more excited the next morning when we woke up and really took in the surroundings. You really feel as though you are one with nature. It's beautiful and invigorating. We ate at The Lakehouse restaurant. It is is on the small side, but the food was good and they were extremely accomodating (especially for my wife who has a ton of serious food allergies.) We used the gym--which was a nice size and had a beautiful view of the Calistoga winery and pool (half of it is outside). A nice touch is that they have complimentary water, Gatorade, fresth fruit and Powerbars. We also took advantage of the amazing spa. My sister and wife received oatmeal and brown sugar scrubs with massages--and couldn't say enough about their experience and the environment. We didn't have enough time to take advantage of all that is offered at Calistoga...but there are guided hikes, yoga, and more offered on most days. Very cool! We did get to take part in a wine tasting hosted by one of the members of Calistoga Ranch--and it was great! It was nice to be able to meet other hotel guests and members. Highly recommend it if there is one offered during your stay. We had a few little glitches...but the Director of Operations contacted us personally and took care of things quickly! We hope to return to Calistoga Ranch again and are jealous of anyone going soon! P.S. No matter the weather make sure you shower in the outside Rain shower!!

Reviews.Title: “Privacy, luxury and peaceful tranquility at Calistoga Ranch”
Reviews.Author: want2getaway
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 3 nights at the Calistoga Ranch and it was heaven! The 1,100 sq ft lodges were amazing, simple yet elegant making you feel more like you were home than at a resort. The amentities were exceptional including an indoor/outdoor fireplace, large deck, an outdoor shower garden. and one of the most comfortable beds ever. The service was outstanding from check-in to check-out., the perfect mix of catering to your every whim yet leaving you alone. The food was excellent. The spa was wonderful, with the outdoor fireplaces and whirpool area. The treatments were top notch. Having stayed in several high end hotels (Ritz Carlton, Four Seasons) the Calistoga Ranch exceeded my expectations and then some. This is the place to go to relax and get away (leave the kids at home!). The property is so quiet, peaceful and relaxing that you will not want to leave. We had planned on several days of touring the wineries in Napa, but only left the Ranch once. It was that special. You won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Propery - Awsome Service”
Reviews.Author: ariemay
Reviews.Content: This exclusive getaway made for a perfect, perfect weekend in the Napa Valley. The "room" was wonderful - actually two rooms which I loved. The double sided fireplace was a nice touch. I found the simple yet elegant decor very soothing. Very spa. A bed this comfortable is hard to leave! The outside shower is enchanting! And not having to pay $4 for water or soda out of the (very cold!) mini-bar is super. The on-site spa is delightful: loved the coupleâ€™s room! The service was superb - start to finish. We checked in very late (Midnight) - when we called in to tell them, they asked if we would like to have a sandwich waiting. The staff are all professional and friendly -very classy yet approachable. The security was excellent: every guest is accounted for with the staff at all times! When you check out your car is brought around and ice cold bottles of water are put in your cup holders for the trip home. Regarding the kids - it's Napa - get a babysitter! (or go to Disney)

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: winewoman63
Reviews.Content: Calistoga Ranch was fabulous! We just got back from four nights there and it was not enough! This is our favorite new place. Service was excellent, food was outstanding and they were child and pet friendly. Wonderful place to stay and relax, go hiking, swim, great workout facility. I can't say enough good things about this place. We will definately be back!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Paradise at Calistoga Ranch!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent two glorious nights at Calistoga Ranch to celebrate our 10th anniversary. We loved everything about it. The lodges are beautiful - well designed, well-maintained and spotlessly clean. Each "room" is actually a free-standing lodge with two buildings separated by a spacious deck. The concept behind the resort's design is "indoor-outdoor living." Our lodge had a living room, fireplace, wet bar and half bath in one building, and the master suite with large bathroom (two counters, each with its own sink) and closet in the second building. The fireplace in the living area is double sided, one side facing into the living room and one facing the deck. There are comfy chairs and ottomans on the deck for lounging. The bed has a feather bed and a down comforter, with lots of pillows. The absolute best feature is the outdoor shower, located on a separate, private deck off the master bathroom (though here is also an indoor shower and tub if you prefer). The service was exemplary. Shortly after we arrived, we received a note from the manager wishing us a happy anniversary, along with a bottle of champagne and a chocolate cake! In addition, whenever we called for any type of service, our needs we met within minutes. For example, my husband called the front desk late the first night and told them he had left his prescription medicine in our car, which had been parked by the valet (valet parking is included). Not five muinutes later, his medicine was delivered to our door. There are shuttles (golf carts) buzzing along the roads constantly, so you can always catch a ride to wherever you want to go on the resort. Towels are changed twice daily. Turndown service on the first night included a box of locally handmade chocolates, and a bottle of massage oil the second night. My husband and I both had massages at the Bathhouse spa - although I choked a bit on the prices at first, I have to admit it was an hour of pure bliss. The massage therapists did an excellent job. There are warm and cool pools to soak in before or after the treatment, and the changing room/showers have everything you could possibly need afterwards, from toothpaste and deodorant to combs and hairdryers. We had breakfast and dinner at the Lakehouse restaurant on-site, with excellent food and service both times. The restaurant has a nice deck with a view over a small lake. Lunch is served at the bar by the pool, and was also very tasty. The poolside service was great - one afternoon it was very hot and the staff offered us cold towels in buckets of ice to cool down. If you are ready for a splurge, this is the place to do it. This is the ultimate romantic getaway!

Reviews.Title: “Calistoga Ranch -- Well Worth It”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Calistoga Ranch in late June of 2006 for four nights. The overall trip was truly memorable. Upon arrival we were upgraded from a deluxe lodge to a forest lodge. I believe that the Ranch has many more of the forest lodges than the deluxe lodges and that may have been a reason why we were upgraded. The forest lodge is compromised of two rooms: (1) the bedroom and bathroom -- with a king size bed, a large bathroom with double sinks, a shower/tub and an outside shower; (2) the second room is a living room with a sofa, two chairs, a bar, another bathroom and a fireplace. I believe the two units combined are somewhere around 1100 square feet. The fireplace is indoor/outdoor. The two rooms are connected by an outdoor living space with two chairs, a table and access to the fire place. It was a really unbelievable space that created a feeling of relaxation. The service was excellent. We recieved a complimentary bottle of wine (Calistoga Ranch Chardonnay) the first night. On the second night we received a bottle of Vueve Clequot Champagne. On the third night we received a cheese tasting plate. In addition to this, all of the non-alcoholic beverages in the mini-fridge are complimentary as well as all of the snacks. The staff at Calistoga Ranch was great; overall they appeared extremely young -- they were all personable and accomodating. The pool was extremely nice; not a huge pool, but extremely relaxing -- a bar is located above the pool area; the service in the pool area was again great. The resort was 95% full the four nights we stayed there according to numerous staff members, but it certaintly did not feel that way. Because of the way that Calistoga Ranch was developed -- with individual lodges, you really never run into other guests unless you go to the pool, restuarant or spa. I thought it was extremely well designed that way and never felt crowded. We went to the restaurant the Lakehouse for dinner. The food was very good and the wine list was interesting. The service at the restaurant was very good. I thought the overall experience there was above average, but probably not on par with some of the unbelievable restuarants in the Napa/Sonoma area. If you are expecting French Laundry this does not compare, but it shouldn't. For what it is though, a really great resort restaurant. The spa was relaxing. My wife and I had a treatment there. The spa was somewhat small, but I did not feel crowded. I do not have spa treatments regularly, so I am probably not the best person to judge the spa. Overall I thought that the treatment was relaxing and reasonably priced. Although Calistoga Ranch is expensive, for the many hotels and resorts in the area, I believe for what you get it is reasonably priced. The experience was the most relaxing I have ever had on vacation and I can't imagine better service. It is a much different experience than your run of the mill hotel; it really creates a feeling of being at an up-scale summer camp. You have the opportunity to hike right outside your front door and there is unbelievable foilage everywhere you look. In addition its location is excellent -- not in a busy area -- off of the Silverado Trail near St. Helena. Easy access to Napa and to Sonoma. I travel a lot for work and stay at many nice hotels and resorts throughout the country and abroad (i.e. Ritz Carlton, Four Seasons, Mandarin Oriental). Calistoga Ranch not only matched but exceeded in many respects the quality and service that you should expect at these establishments. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Very Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: beachbug
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a three night stay and overall I was extremely impressed. We had one glitch, which I will note below, but otherwise my experience there was superb. Resort and Rooms: I stayed in a deluxe lodge and I think I really lucked out in terms of location. The size of the indoor living space was a little small, but the large bathroom and outdoor living space more than made up for this. It is so beautiful there that you will want to spend most of your time outdoors anyway. The resort itself does an amazing job of making the most of its natural location and the outdoor fireplace and shower were a very nice touch. My lodge was located near the restaurant and spa which was great, because we could just walk to these places. Pool area was another highlight of the resort. It was the perfect size. I never felt like I was at a mega resort although the weekend I was at the Ranch there happened to be a wedding and it became apparent that the pool area may have been understaffed. Otherwise the pool service was terrific and the lounge chairs were very comfortable. Restaurant: I only had dinner once at the restaurant and breakfast there once. The staff was very attentive, even bringing us free champagne when they heard it was my birthday. The portions at dinner are small but I found them to be quite filling. I am not a big eater and I can see where someone with a more hearty appetite might come away unsatiated. Breakfast was especially good and we also loved room service. Our deck was so nice that half the time we didn't want to go anywhere else to eat. Spa: I had the "Traditional" at the spa and overall I enjoyed it. The person I went with had the same and we both felt that the spa was above-average, although maybe not exceptional. I loved the indoor/outdoor treatment rooms and the view from the relaxation area, but I could see where the space is not that large and if it was fully booked it could become uncomfortable. Overall I would recommend a treatment there, just because if you are spending this much money to stay some place you might as well try the spa. It will enhance the experience. Service: Service was exceptional. Everyone goes out of their way to please you, except we had one glitch when we checked out. For the entire duration of our stay the men who escorted us to our lodge on the golf carts would always pull up the hill in front of our lodge and drop us at the stairs. They did this when they checked us in with our luggage and every time thereafter. On the morning of checkout they refused to pick us up on top of the hill and the individual at the front desk told me that the five other individuals that had been shuttling us back in forth the entire time were not supposed to bring the golf cart all of the way up and that they would not pick us up there. This may not be a problem for most people, but I was travelling with a senior citizen and we ended up having to carry most of our own luggage down the hill, because not only had they refused to pick us up at the top of the hill, but they seemed to forget that we were checking out even though we told them multiple times. I am not someone who expects staff to cater to her every whim, but at these prices I also would not have expected them to refuse to do something they had been doing along. I have to say I found the attitude of the individual at the desk that morning to be just not fitting with the rest of the staff at the resort, but I think that person may just have been an outlier. The morale of this story is if you are travelling with an older individual or someone who may have some type of physical disability you may want to double check the location of your lodge and both the number of hills and stairs to where they will drop you in a golf cart. Other than that the trip was terrific and I really loved the Ranch. It is the perfect place if you want to totally get away and enjoy the vineyards or even just nature.

Reviews.Title: “Dynamite Joint!”
Reviews.Author: stevieNewYork
Reviews.Content: Fantastic place, beautifully appointed, friendly, hard working and caring staff. The restaurant which the staff really pushed was worth the pushing food was dynamite. I took my wife there for her birthday we both can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Ranch”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went for our anniversary, it was a fantastic choice. The service was wonderful, we couldn't have been happier! It was hard to make ourselves leave the property because it was so relaxing and enjoyable. Overall it was the best hotel we've stayed in. We will def. return

Reviews.Title: “Loved the ranch!”
Reviews.Author: oneLmichele1111
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were looking to go to Napa and relax. Well, we did just that. The service was excellent, they could not do enough. The surroundings were peaceful and private.My husband loved the outside shower. The suite was spacious,the bed very comfortable. Mellow feel in the living room. Nice touch with the complimentary minibar and wine. great stereo system. Concierge was very helpful! It was very hot- 100-110 everyday but the staff would always cool the car down before we got in, ice cold bottled water was waiting for us in the car, nice touch. At the pool, cold towels were served as well as their iced tea-lemonade concoction. Comfortable lounge chairs! The restaurant was located in a tranquil setting- watch out for mosquitos(time of year)... The food was great. Try the tasting menu. I had a facial which was one of the best I ever had. My husband enjoyed plunging in the mineral springs water hot tub. Very laid back understated class. I highly recommend if you want pure relaxation!

Reviews.Title: “Very relaxing, beautiful resort”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to Napa, and our first visit to Calistoga Ranch. Both were wonderful. Trekking around the valley all day can be tiring and the Calistoga Ranch is a fantastic oasis to return to. We had a great time. The suites are luxurious, comfortable and private. We had an Oak Creek suite which was very private. My sense is that some are considerably more private than others. The beds are super comfortable and we enjoyed three nights of blissful sleep. The setting itself in the valley is amazing. The hills surrounding the resort give a feeling of isolation and remoteness from the outside world. The hotel has a hiking trail above the valley that is a MUST do! We were the only couple we saw using the trail in the 3 days we visited and we were so happy that we did it. Please try it, you will note be disappointed. The views are spectacular. Service was good and the restaurant was excellent, although we found the wine list to be surprisingly light and very expensive. There are restaurants with much deeper wine lists in the area. They need to work on this point. The other problem we had, is that there is no area to relax other than your room. There is no lounge area to get a coffee or snack. You have to go to the small bar area at the restaurant. Not ideal... All in all a superb resort. Well managed, well run and very quiet and private.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice relaxing stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband & I received a spa lodge gift certificate and used it for our anniversary. I was very impressed with the property. They certainly took care to make the rooms as private as possible by the enclosures around the private decks and the foliage. I agree with everyone that it will seem much more secluded once the foliage matures, but I never felt exposed while on my deck or in the hot tub. The suites were enormous â€“ I have never stayed in such an expansive room before! We did not take full advantage of the living room area, but it was nice it was there. Since the weather was gorgeous when we were there we spent most of our time on the deck or away from the room altogether. I wish it had been a little cooler so we could have used the outdoor fireplace â€“ maybe another time! We used the spa for massages & it was very nice. The spa was not quite as big as I would have expected though. The waiting area was a little small and there were not enough chairs for my husband and I to sit in before our massages â€“ we had to stand and wait around which was a little disappointing. The changing room was not large either â€“ there were several of us all trying to get into our lockers at once and we were on top of one another. We ate at the Lakehouse restaurant which was delicious. I was happy to have a good restaurant on the property so we didnâ€™t have to drive anywhere. There were a lot of extra touches that I appreciated: When I booked our room I had mentioned it was our anniversary so they brought a bottle of champagne and dessert to our room; fruit and free drinks in the fridge were great â€“ a nice relief not to pay $3.50/bottle and there were cold bottles of water in the car upon our departure. It is pricey to stay here â€“ we were happy most of our stay was paid for. I would definitely stay here again though. It is tailored to outdoor living so I would not want to stay here when it was cold or especially when it was raining.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, Peaceful Getaway”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We chose the Calistoga Ranch for a Business Meeting and beginning of a two night getaway. For a Business Meeting it's wonderful if you have one of the rooms with a separte living room, our guest did. This resort is just over a year old. Once you arrive, you are driven by golf cart to your room. We stayed in the Sage Lake Lodge. The vines are just starting to cover the buildings, but the property is still beautiful. The room has a very unique beauiful bathroom, his and her sides with a shower and large soaking tub in the middle. Floors are slate. Counters are marble. There is also a private outside shower which is wonderful, and a sunbathing lounge chair in the same area. As you approach your room there is a very nice deck with an outdoor gas fireplace and reading chairs. There is also a small table with two chairs on the walkway to the room. When you open all the blinds in your room, you have a beautiful view of oak trees. The bedroom is a little small but very comfortable. The restaurant was just a few feet from our room and we had a very good breakfast there. It looks like a creek may run right in front of our room, but during the summer everything is dry.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hide Away - poor room service”
Reviews.Author: happa00
Reviews.Content: The entree is great and if you go for a creek lodge you will get the quiet surrounding that you expect. However due to the success of the owners lodges (time share model) they built 6 more of this big suite houses and i guess when they are finished it could drift into a high end campground flair, if the hotel management is not watching the expansion carefully. After this last 6 suite expansion they definatly should stop to prevent the downgrade of style and hideaway charme. Here is a advise for those who like to stay at the suite and just relax. DO NOT TRY ROOMSERVICE FOR DINNER. Even you get a complimentory estate chardonnay, they forgot to bring new glasses for a new ordered high price wine ( hey, we are in the wine country, and i guess they should know all about tasting ). Also the food ( fish super small, low taste, high price ) is not worth mentioning. So i recommend to go the extra mile for the estate restaurant ( reservation recommended) and get excellant food and service there. Also for the ones who have a light sleep the AC is quite loud and can just be switched to auto or on/off. However, the place is so beautiful we actually stayed a night longer than planed, as we found complete relexation.

Reviews.Title: “Decadent”
Reviews.Author: wiki
Reviews.Content: It's an incredibly luxurious retreat. Rooms are beautiful. Grounds are beautiful. It's a very tranquil setting.

Reviews.Title: “Casual Elegance”
Reviews.Author: sophie11
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at Calistoga Ranch. Although it was a bit of a splurge, it was a great get away. The spa was beautiful. We stayed in a one bedroom lodge with a living room. The outdoor shower and deck with the fireplace were the best. The room was very well appointed and quiet. As it is quite roomy and the living room is separate from the bedroom, I don't think this is a set up for kids. We were shuttled to our room via golf cart, or took the short walk and it was never a problem. The car was always waiting with water and the service was very friendly. The outdoor pool is serene -- very relaxing. If you are looking for manicured, formal lodging, this isn't the place. The setting is much more natural and I can imagine in a few years when the landscaping grows in how beautiful it will be. The restaurant had a great dinner - again a bit pricey, but the food and setting was beautiful -- complete with deer roaming in the valley right off of the deck while we were eating. For a special treat, we'd stay there again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “has come into it's own...”
Reviews.Author: rkr727
Reviews.Content: We stayed here last year shortly after it's opening and found many deficiencies in service. We returned just recently for three days and found that staff has hit a comfortable rhythm. We upgraded to the oak/creekside and it made a big difference from the hillside studio we had last year. The separate living space and bedroom lent a comfortable separation of space. The room was private and beautifully appointed. The beds are like big cocoons, with comfortable linens and fluffy duvets. We spent one afternoon on the deck with the fireplace nicely heating the area, just reading while sipping wine and listening to the creek rushing by. The food in the restaurant is very good; the room service was on the money; the spa services are absolutely superb; and the space is beautiful and tranquil. It has a great indoor/outdoor gym. As far as I know it's the only high end property in the napa valley that allows you to bring your furry family member, and we met several there. Everyone was quite accommodating to our little dog. The staff are sweet and eager to please even under circumstances where the overprivileged and overindulged ugly american guest makes their acquaintance. We would highly recommend this hotel. (forget the credit card limit)

Reviews.Title: “Loved the architecture”
Reviews.Author: mosum
Reviews.Content: We spent a day at the Calistoga Ranch. It was a wonderful getaway for a couple. We found our unit actually quiet and away from the construction. The spa treatment was superior to most. The food, service and level of care was superior to almost all the 4 star hotels, but not quiet up to the level of a 5 star hotel. I would go again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay, "kind of zen rustic"!”
Reviews.Author: champagne gal
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a fabulous trip to Napa. Being a woman and traveling by myself I was a little apprehensive to go on this trip. This is proved to be a great trip. I stayed at the new Caligosta Ranch resort, beautiful rooms. I did feel like I was in a zen like atmosphere with the rooms being built up against a mountainside. Everything was done with perfection in mind, luxurious linens on the bed, indoor and outdoor showers. The staff couldn't have been nicer in arranging dinner reservations at area restaurants but my best dinner was on the property at the resorts outstanding restaurant. Everything was well presented by the waiter with a description of how the each dish was prepared. Excellent all around!
